Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons of Hotel Principe”
Reviews.Author: V E
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principe has a nice location not to far from bus and train station so getting from airport was easy. Hotel Lobby was nice, room less so. Our room was on the 5th floor but the lift only goes to the 4th floor so you have to use the stairs to reach it. Our room was small but clean. Biggest problem was that the floor of the bathroom is about 3 inches higher than the bedroom floor which is somewhat hazardous. The shower is also very small and entry would be difficult for a larger person. Breakfast was first class - lots of variety and the waiters kept the food coming. Sounds like reviews depend upon the room that they were assigned. Definitely avoid the 5th floor which makes it more of a 2 or 3 star experience than a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: nottmmike
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel coverted from three old buildings situated directly on the Canale Grande just down from the railway station, so a hotel with character. The rooms are comfortable, there is a great terrace overlooking the Canale Grande, and at breakfast you can watch the "commuter traffic" from your table. In the evening a pianist plays in the bar, and although the street outside is always busy, you are far away from the rip-off restaurants around St Mark's Square and there are plenty of nice and reasonably priced local restaurants no more than 5 - 10 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous views of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethChester
Reviews.Content: The long terrace with plenty of tables and chairs and the large and small dining rooms, as well as the bar face the Grand Canal. It's worth walking over the bridge by the railway station and looking over the water at the hotel. At first our bedroom on the 3rd floor seemed small, but we later appreciated the large size of the bed with 2 independent mattresses. It was made up with sheets, a blanket and a lightweight cover with another blanket, a heavier cover and extra pillows in the wardrobe. The fridge was full and could not therefore be used for personal supplies. We found our own miniboiler useful for making hot drinks. Storeage was very good with large wardrobes and plenty of drawer space. There was also one large table, a dressing table, several chairs and a television with good picture quality. The bathroom was fully tiled and had modern fitments with large towels, changed daily. Near our bedroom was a small outdoor area with shrubs, that would be cooler during hot.weather, although it had a street and not a canal view. Staff at Reception were pleasant and efficient, but waiters in the dining room at breakfast, concentrated on replenishing the food at the buffet and provided no service. You had to find your own table and then get cutlery etc. There was a good choice of cereals, of bread rolls and especially of croissants, one plain and two containing jam and honey. The cooked food was under covers and the bacon was apparently good. The breakfast times are from 6.30 to 10 am and, at busy times, the small adjoining room was opened. This was much quieter. We did not dine in the hotel, as we found the prices off putting. The cheapest main course was chicken at 16 euros, while the tasting menu, advertised outside the front door, was 50 euros for meat and 60 for fish. Just across the road is Brek Ristorante, where young people and families eat, as well as tourists. Go to the counter right inside, if you want pasta dishes and they will be heated while you wait. There are also plenty of restaurants near the hotel, offering tourist menus.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: goldenoldie46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 5 minutes from Ferrovia so makes it ideal for getting from the bus or train station if you're not great at wheeling your suitcase through the streets. It also makes it easy to get everywhere because the No1 vaporetto also stops at Ferrovia and on that line you can get down to St Marks Square in approx 40mins, The Rialto in 15. Okay so back to the hotel- it is very clean so hats off to the chambermaids. Breakfast is continental although there are boiled and scrambled eggs as well fried parma ham. This being Venice they also do a range of brioche and a good fruit salad. If you like black coffee american style press expresso on the coffee maker and then place your cup under the hot water nozzle. If you ask for a room overlooking the canal it can get noisy with the water buses and other traffic. There is a terrace overlooking the canal so order an aperitivo and watch the world go by. The hotel dinner menu looked exciting but exceeded my budget but there are lots of different eateries around the hotel. Venture over the bridge and carry straight on for a couple of favourites.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: grandma73034
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a balcony on the canal. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony sipping wine watching the canal traffice and the setting sun.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Room, big bathroom”
Reviews.Author: spawithlisab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a tour and it was nice. The room was clean and cozy, there was not much room to move about but the bathroom made up for it. It was nearly the size of the bed room. The hotel itself was pleasant, the staff friendly. We did have the buffet breakfast and it was average. Croissants, cheese, eggs, bacon, muffins, juice etc. Nothing spectacular but was decent. I would recommend the hotel, based on the fact that I have not stayed anywhere else in Venice. Oh and the views of the canal were nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Holly B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location for people arriving in to Venice by buses, trains or indeed water taxis and vaporetto. It was really easy to find with shops and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The hotel is in a word stunning. The lobby, hotel bar, dining room and terrace are beautiful and the view is to die for. The staff at reception were courteous and polite, not the most friendly of people for sure but nice enough. The breakfast as other people have mentioned in reviews is lovely with a wide variety and plenty of it! Another plus point was that it was served from 6.30-10.30am so suitable for early birds and late risers alike. The only reason I couldn't give a 5 rating was that the room was a litle bit of a let down. Upon entering our room (507) I felt a little betrayed as the elegance and beauty of the downstairs in the hotel had not reached our room. The room was a little on the small side and I found that it if you need to shave your legs in the shower you need to open the doors and stick your leg out of the shower as there was not enough room inside! There was also an exposed pipe and the carpet was looking rather tired. Almost like a hotel of two halves- downstairs was a lovely four star hotel upstairs in the room i stayed in 2/scraping 3 stars. BUT.. that said for the price I paid I shouldn't grumble too much, besides who spends very long in a hotel room when you are in the most beautiful city in the world. I think I was just a little disappointed having seen pictures of other rooms and the downstairs of the hotel that my room did not live up to those expectations. I had a view of the rooftops of houses which to be honest is all I paid for and nice enough. If you can afford it I would pay for a better room and a canal view however if you are just looking for a well located hotel with somewhere to rest for the night then a standard room in this hotel is perfect! I visited in April and can only imagine how lovely it would be to sit out on the terrace in the evening in the summer. I would return to this hotel and recommend it to friends just bear in mind if you pay for a standard room don't expect to see a room like the ones shown on their website.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_LouBrighton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a few minute's walk from the station facing the canal. We had a beautiful double aspect room on the second floor, with stunning views over Venice. The room was stunning with fabulous Merano glass chandeliers. The bathroom was a little small, but that is only a minor comment. The staff are courteous, friendly and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, lovely food, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: charlton97
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Principe is a lovely hotel with great canal views. its is excellent value and the rooms are spacious, clean with comfortable beds. The view onto the canal was stunning. the breakfast is great and plentiful, scrambled eggs, bacon etc and lots of fresh fruit daily. the hotel is ideally located, shops and restaurants are close by. would thouroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best avoided!”
Reviews.Author: isaw19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights at the end of March 2012 as part of a package tour. Not a happy experience. First impressions of lobby and lounge are reasonable but upstairs decor is scruffy and tired and rooms look as if they haven't been refurbished for at least thirty years. I paid a supplement for a single room. The first room I was offered (201) was so small that there was nowhere to put my suitcase. Very reluctantly and under some pressure from our tour rep I was offered another room (224), nominally a double, which was better but only just. Small double bed pushed up against wall with wardrobe at end meaning person on inside unable to get in/out. The bed was hard as were the pillows and bedding barely adequate (ancient blanket plus satin counterpane) though room was clean. Fellow travelers were also unhappy with their rooms - noisy if overlooking street at front, smelly if overlooking central courtyard. From 8.00am onwards the breakfast room was pandemonium - nowhere to sit and staff unable to clear tables fast enough. Breakfast adequate but only just - cheap orange juice, tinned pineapple etc. Hotel may have canal side location but it was impossible to book a table on the terrace for dinner for any of the four nights of our stay because of "corporate reservations" which seemed to mean that most of the tables were empty most of the time. In addition, the quality of the breakfasts didn't inspire much confidence in the competence of the kitchen. This hotel is in the business of turning around as many package tours as fast as possible. Definitely not a good choice for the independent (or, indeed, any) traveler. The Grand Canal is such a dominant presence in Venice that you don't need to stay in a canal-side hotel to enjoy/experience it. Best feature of this hotel was its location close to Ferrovia vaporetti stop, a major interchange, outside the station. However, overall this hotel did not come close to the expectations created by its 3 star rating. Next time I go to Venice I shall look for a small, independent hotel in a back street away from the main drag of which there are many.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Hotel on the Grand Canal with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mefixer
Reviews.Content: Spent a three day weekend at the hotel and found it to be a clean, well cared for establishment. The staff were all polite and courteous, except for the head waiter in the dining room that got out of joint when one afternoon we wanted to sit at one of the tables on the veranda outside the dining room on the Grand Canal. That incident aside everyone else was very nice and helpful. The breakfasts are sumptuous and if get there early enough you can actually get a table right on the Grand Canal. The Hotel is convenient to the train station and all the water buses. It is closer to the entrance in to the town than to St. Marks, so it is a fair walk to get to the great square (very nice). The hotel is also near the Jewish Ghetto and all its sights. The hotel dÃ©cor could be classified as slightly antiquated opulence and it takes a while to get used to all the heavy drapes and plush carpets. We took the free water taxi offered by the hotel to the Island of Merano, but the down side is that they leave you off in one of the more expensive glass factories. Once they realize you are not interested in buying they give you the old heave-ho and you have to fend your own way back to town. Still speeding along in the water taxi was quite fun. The hotel is not inexpensive but compared to all the other Venetian hotels of a similar standard, it was not too bad. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a location in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: scotland067
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Principe in Venice in early March. We chose a room which overlooks the canal. What a view, what an experience. You can look out of your window at any time and see gondolas going by your window, boats carrying anything into or out of Venice. The people who workde the front desk were very helpful and spoke perfect English. The restaurant had a fabulous menu and the breakfast was alos wonderful with many choices. Unless you are really into glass don't get hooked into a free boat ride to Murano. We went on this little trip and were very uncomfortable with the pressure put onus to buy glassware. Hotel Principe is within walking distance of the main garages and right at the train station. You will nt go wrong by staying at the Hotel Principe.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: Qonrad G
Reviews.Content: Great location, only a 2 minute walk to the train station. Very convenient! Quaint, clean hotel with very friendly staff. One disappointment was that we just need 2 pages printed for our boarding pass for our flight home. The gentleman at the desk (who I will not name) was not ready to accommodate eventhough I said I'd pay for the pages. We were told to walk over the bridge where there was an Internet cafe. Yes it was just 10 minutes away but that's not the point. But apart from that, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: 12skip
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but quaint with great views. The hotel is well located, clean and nicely appointed. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I arrived from the airport by water taxi right at the hotel's dock on the Grand Canal. There's a nice patio off the dining room that looks out over the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “my stay feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: lisa c
Reviews.Content: i have just returned from a trip to venice staying at the hotel principe and it was excellent! we did have a delux room overlooking the canal and it was beautiful, the room was a good size with good facilities and very comfortable.The hotel itself was also very good the staff were friendly and attentive, it has a nice bar area with an outside trerrace on the grand canal and a good restaurant/breakfast area, the breakfast was lovely with plenty of choice from eggs and bacon to cereal and breads and cheese,fruit and yoghurt.The hotel is located close to the station and the main bus terminal making transfer easy from both the airport or train but is also in a good location to walk to the main sites of venice like the rialto.If I had to find fault it would be that it is starting to look worn around the edges and prehaps a refurb is due but this is no way detracted from the overall ambiance and experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: We arrived by train and found it quick and easy to get to the hotel. Inside the hotel is very grand with traditional italian decor. The room was very basic and the bed wasn't particularly comfortable but as it was the Venice Carnival we were not in the hotel much anyway. We had a pleasant stay and would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good honest hotel with excellent facilities and staff”
Reviews.Author: Tony45_11
Reviews.Content: We read some reviews on this hotel after we had booked it and can quite honestly say that had we not booked already, we would not have gone there. However, we were very pleasantly surprised. We arrived in Venice at 09.30hrs after travelling overnight on Thello from Paris. We were cold and hungry and yearned for a shower but aware that we could not book in until 14.00hrs. We had already arranged via the booking service to leave our luggage at the hotel whilst we did a bit of the tourist thing. Arriving at the hotel we were greeted by the manager who suggested we could go to our room straight away - what a blessing. The furniture is great, shabby sheek, whereas some reviews said it was "old". It is fairly luxourious, well staffed, very comfortable. Breakfast is good and you can eat as much as you like. A short walk from the railway station and water bus stops, the hotel is ideally sited for tourist. The bathroom had bath and shower together with a bidet. The bed was comfortable and clean linen provided every day. There is nothing I can say against this hotel. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative in Cannaregio”
Reviews.Author: MattiasBM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few minutes walk away from the train and busstation which makes it easy access from the airport. The hotel is situated just beside the Grand canal which so you really feel the Veneize touch. Rooms are a bit 'old' style and haven't been refurbished for a while. Breakfast was very good and staff was very friendly and provided good serrvice. The location makes it easy access to waterways and the northern part of venize however it's a good 30 min walk to Marcus plaza so if you don't like to walk a lot perhaps this is not the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful and uncaring staff”
Reviews.Author: Johntrombone
Reviews.Content: The hotel showed stunning rooms online. The reality was small cramped rooms. Wheat free diet was asked for and extra pillows. Got the pillows after a struggle but they had never heard of a wheat free diet. Staff grumpy and unhelpful except when hoping for a tip on the last morning. Good location but would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room, tiny shower”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of the bus station and train station. You can also walk to the Casino to Venezia. The good things about the hotel: 1. The location is great 2. Internet works great 3. Adequate breakfast 4. Nice friendly staff. 5. Bidet in the bathroom adds a nice touch Bad things about the hotel 1. ridiculously small shower. An Average size person can barely fit in the shower 2. rooms are paper thin. This was a problem one night when there was a large group of loud men in the next room talking till 4 am 3. Rooms are small, but I have a feeling that's just the way it is in Venice 4. The hotel cannot possibly be 4 star by any standard. Overall a nice experience, but by billing itself as a 4 star, and by the deceptive pictures on the web, my expectations were a bit higher

Reviews.Title: “staying in venice, italy.....”
Reviews.Author: alicia D
Reviews.Content: I observed that with regards to inquiry , you better asked search by yourself regarding the location and the mode of transportation... to avoid unnecessary spending or overspending. In eating outside the hotel, or on the outside restaurants... better to read first the menu regarding the extra charges, as we get surprised when we get to know that the extra plates have charges, we requested extra 3 small plates and they have charged us equivalent to buying 1 pasta. whew! the waiter did not informed us before giving the extra plates, instead he told us that it is in the menu, wherein I am sure that the customer's focus is on the food that he wants to order. Enjoy the view, dont mind the people or the citizen of that country...so as not to spoil your tour... in general as i have observed... they practice racism.. it is not good....they should respect tourists/customers fairly.

Reviews.Title: “will return soon”
Reviews.Author: richardb621
Reviews.Content: I was in Italy for a retreat and Hotel Principe was recommended by someone, so I took the train and found out is convince to the train and bus station .walking distance. This Hotel was very old and even used a actual key to open the door .The room was small and clean, the bed was great ,the price was reasonable ,the reception manager said a view would be double and suggest the back in much quieter because in Venice most people are touring the city . The breakfast had great food and plenty of selection, to choose from. I will be going back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “return visit”
Reviews.Author: holidayboy9
Reviews.Content: we have just returned to the principe for the 5th time. still the same friendly staff very clean rooms exellent breakfast room overlooking the grand canal. beware of the new city tax in venice payable at checkout introduced a few months ago. we payed 20 euros tax for our three night stay.

Reviews.Title: “A spacious, but inexpensive 4 star hotel on the canal”
Reviews.Author: splashIstanbul
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Venice many times before cause we used to do business around the area,but we've never stayed in Venice before.(in Mestre)This time, it was going to be a vacation,so I wanted to stay at a hotel on the canal in Venice.I found Hotel Principe on the net and booked 2 rooms for 4.The price was 60 euros per person including an open buffet breakfast. The hotel is very close to the train station which is a good asset because don't forget that you have to carry your suitcases to the hotel since there are no cars there:) Other than that, the hotel was good,the rooms were spacious and comfortable contrary to many Venice hotels where the rooms are tiny.The staff was friendly and helpful,but our favorite thing about this hotel was the breakfast room with the magnificent canal view.We really enjoyed our breakfasts a lot. The breakfast room had a nice terrace in the front,but in November, we couldn't use it unfortunately. The only negative thing I can tell about the hotel would be that before we went,I've sent an email to them asking them to book a restaurant close to the hotel since we were going to arrive late.When nobody answered,I've called them and asked about it.The lady from the reservation gave me another email address saying she would answer me back, but nothing happened:))) So luckily we found a nice pizza restaurant close by and had a nice dinner that night.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: caratania
Reviews.Content: To be fair, we weren't paying for this one as we were guests at an awards ceremony so I can't rate this hotel on a value for money basis. The receptionist could not have been more helpful and upgraded us to a room with a King size bed, a view over the Grand Canal and a small balcony. The room was a bit faded in parts but the bathroom was large (shower only) and clean and the bed very comfortable. Very good quality towels. Venice is a hotbed of bad hotels ands B&Bs (we stayed in one a few years back which is best forgotten) and this is not a bad hotel at all. It's easy to walk to the Rialto and San Marco and perfect if you're arriving by train or by water taxi from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one like the Venetian plaque”
Reviews.Author: lamb04
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with an Italian friend to celebrate her birthday. She pushed the boat out and went for the super deluxe room with 2 beds with a balcony overlooking the Grande Canal as shown on their website. When we arrived they made us wait an hour for the room to be ready, and we had to keep prompting them. They were very rude (and we both speak Italian!). When we were shown to the room, which had only one bed ('it is impossible to have 2 beds!') it was just an ordinary room, though on the front, worlds away from the photos and descriptions on the web page, and for which we were paying a fortune. I complained and they put us in the room next door which was slightly larger, but no better. Over the entire 4 days, we saw no staff, and any questions were answered with a nasty stare at best. Although they bill themselves as top rate, they mostly had BUS TOURS to whom they devoted all their time and energy (though no charm). My friend and I are both world travellers and have stayed in some of the best and also modest but interesting hotels all over the world, from Paris to Uzbekistan. This hotel just saw 2 middle-aged women, and decided they could treat us like garbage, which they proceeded to do. I usually consider myself a very lucky traveller, but this hotel defies all omens. Venice, however, remains spectacular, especially out of season (November).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great Room”
Reviews.Author: Matt A
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my 40th birthday and to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary and we were to stay for 5 nights however there was a problem!!!!! When we went to check-in we were told by reception that there had been a problem with the central computer meaning that they had over booked for the first night only. They asked us if we would mind goiing to another Hotel just down the street which they had arranged for us which was also 4 * and the same facilities then when we return the next day he will sort us out with a very Nice room overlooking the Grand Canal. We agreed and was taken down to the other hotel. When we returned the next day to the Hotel Principe, The Reception Guy Remembered us and appologised once more and again told us that we will have a very nice room. The Porter took our bags up to room 418 which was fantastic. The room was very spacious carpeted with thick pile cream carpet, a shanelier and matching wall lights with 2 singel beds butted up to each other with a large headboard. We had a big flat screen TV, Telephone, Mini Bar, Dressing Table and a big walk-in wardrobe complete with light, Sheves, Rail and safety deposit box (Free) The bathroom was tiled with a massive mirror, a vanity sink, shower toilet with bidet. (Loads of freebies including slippers) We had a very big balcony/ Terrace which overlooked the grand canal as promised. The views were breathtaking and it was great to sit out and watch the sun go down at night with a bottle of red. The Breakfast was reasonably good with cerial, bacon, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, Meats, Cheeses, sweet breads, Yoghurt, Jams Etc Loads of stuff including juices and of coarse Tea & Coffee. I would stay here again without a doubt First class

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sandyk444
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is wonderful! I was pleasantly suprised at how luxurious it seemed for the price. It is a great location right near the Train station. An easy walk from there. It is a little more of a walk, but still not bad to the bus station to get to the airport. You do have to go over a bridge for that with your luggage. The staff was very helpful! I was originally in a triple room and we changed it to 2 separate rooms. The single room charge was very reasonable and they put me in a double for the single price. The shower is small and there are only two TV news channels in English. This was true of everywhere I stayed. Breakfast is in a very nice room with full linens and a fairly good selection. The hotel is right on the canal and has a beautiful seating area outside. Most of the hotels did not have this. There is a pretty cool little Irish Pub really close and plenty of shopping and restaurants right outside. The water ferry is really close and makes getting around very easy. It was a wonderful place. Would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location!”
Reviews.Author: mack15
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel and its location on the Grand Canal. The lobby is beautiful and the hotel terrace overlooking the canal is very nice. The weather did not cooperate while we were there because it was raining, but I would definitely recommend this hotel to other visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Close to train station”
Reviews.Author: LM-Delaware
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Principe has a lovely lobby and beautiful location, being right on the canal and very close to the train station. However the staff was indifferent and not very friendly. When trying to book a water taxi to the airport, we were told to do it the evening before our departure. The evening before, we spoke to a desk clerk, who told us to do it in the morning of our departure. On the morning of our departure, another clerk indicated he might have trouble getting us a taxi. We complained that we had spoken to their staff who gave us the instructions....so, my suggestion is to either book it yourself before leaving or speak to the general manager directly bypassing the clerks. Leave yourself enough time (30 min or longer trip to the airport) and enough euros... a water taxi cost us 110 euros. Otherwise, the hotel was convenient and adequate. The room was small but clean. Breakfast was great with self serve coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Handy place to stay and nice entertainment in dining room and bar area at night”
Reviews.Author: marymc76
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice for a long weekend and found this hotel very convenient and comfortable to stay in. After a very good breakfast in a lovely dining room overlooking the Grand Canal, we were out all day sightseeing. When we returned late in the evening it was great to have dinner in the hotel and not have the bother of finding somewhere to eat, or going on a water taxi late in the night to return to the hotel. There was a lovely singer/guitar player entertaining guests in the dining room until 10pm. He then continued playing and singing in the bar/lounge area until 11.30pm. Dining room staff excellent. We really enjoyed staying here. They offer complimentary water taxi to Murano from the terrace of the hotel. Good idea to buy a 24hour ticket for travelling on the vaporetto water bus before you go there, then you can use it to get back. Overall an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel on the Grand Canal, Convenient and Classy”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea T
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principe was the final hotel we stayed in during our trip to Italy. It was the best! It was located merely seconds from the train stations (much nicer than the people who had to weave through all of venice with their rolling luggage trying to find their lodging). The staff was friendly and the hotel was beautiful, decorated with Murano glass fixtures everywhere. Both evenings we sat on the deck outside on the Grand Canal listening to the musician play all of our favorite songs while enjoying some after dinner drinks. Hope to stay there again someday!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sydcar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before leaving on a cruise. Our room had a view of the Grand Canal and was lovely in the old Venice style. We had a good night's sleep with the air conditioning which was quiet and the hotel was to the quality I would expect of it's star rating. We arrived early (11am),and the Concierge organised a room for us in about 15 minutes which after travelling all the way from Australia was wonderful. The breakfast in the dining room with the view of the Grand Canal was superb. This hotel is also within walking distance to the Santa Lucia station and Piazzale Roma Bus Terminal. I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mickoj
Reviews.Content: We just had a one night stay. The staff were very professional.The room was very clean and reasonably spacious. We left our luggage there before check in and also left it there after check out for a few hours and there was not a problem. The air con worked well even in the 34c conditions of mid September. The location is ideal, only a few minutes walk from the main train station. Its also ideal for the public bus station but its a bit of a drag over the main bridge with heavy luggage but if you are reasonably fit then its not a problem. There is a nice canal side restaurant but the food for dinner was average, breakfast was very good with a good variety on offer . The hotel is spacious and we would recommended it and definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: swatibadani
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant experience but a bit marred during check in. We had already booked a room for 3 with a view but when we were checking in we were told that if we wanted the room we had asked for we would have to pay more!!!! When we refused the person at the desk agreed to give us the room at the quoted price but we had to give him money in cash. Never expected this in Europe. The room was very comfortable and the view of the Grand Canal worth getting up to in the morning. Very close proximity to the railway station and excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: TheCap1Banker
Reviews.Content: We arrived one day before our cruise and used this hotel for the overnight stay. The location is very close to the railway station and you can walk to the hotel in less than 5 minutes and with no bridges to cross. We arrived by plane and used the water taxi service with was 100 Euro for 4 people with all our luggage. Their is an alternative to come in buy water bus called the Aliguna for a a cost of about 13 Euro per person but you will need you cross the Rialto bridge to get to the hotel. If you have less than one package and have the strength its manageable. The hotel room we received was as expected very small compared to NY standards. On the other hand if you take the attitude that you sleep and get out, it works. The a/c was a little bit to desire as it only works well when the lights are off. During the day it did not cool well. WE had a balcony room and the sun was beating on our windows, Since we were there in September it was livable for July and August, I don't know if the a/c would have worked well even in the evening. Going to the cruise ship again we used the water taxi again which again was pretty expensive.. Again you have the choice of the Alliguna for about 7-9 Euro per person and was available near the train station. The last choice was to shlep you packages over several bridges and then on to a tram to the ships. This is not a good idea. You are very close to the Ghetto and can walk there in less than 10 minutes and Gam Gam. The general staff were pretty nice but the day manager needs a vacation. Everything was stressing him out. Just note that you be charged an additional 4 Euro per person per day government tax which is not included even if you prepay your stay.

Reviews.Title: “The view from this hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: wtravelerAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in July and loved the location and view from this hotel. The staff were quite friendly. I would like to go back and stay at this hotel again. This is a 4 star hotel but looks like a 5-star hotel. The grand canal view was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff, lovely view - does the job!”
Reviews.Author: cinnamonuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before joining a cruise from San Basilio. There is a vaparetto stop about two minutes walk from the hotel (in front of the train station) and there are some great little restaurants and shops surrounding the hotel if needed. We emailed ahead and asked for a room with a view if possible and although they didn't email me back and answer my questions, they had upgraded us to a canal view room with a lovely big balcony which was very kind indeed and a lovely surprise. The room itself was nicely decorated, nothing special but it had a nice Venetian feel to it. The air conditioning worked but the porter explained not to leave the balcony door open if we needed the air con to be on. The bathroom was large and was perfectly clean and adequate. Breakfast was pleasant, a relaxed buffet style in a lovely canal front room. Again, it did the job but was nothing outstanding. No complaints though. If I had to pick fault, I'd say that the staff on the front desk could be more welcoming and there are areas in which service could improve. All in all though, we had a lovely experience of Venice whilst staying here and I would return for another short stay.

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Lisette L
Reviews.Content: Wow, we arrived, at the hotel, told the hotel the air was not working, they sent a bell boy who said , well it's just cause the maid had the windows open, we are not at 29 degrees in a so called 4 star hotel, with no air, stains on the carpet, the list goes on, try and avoid this hotel..... There are much better in the area...

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect But Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Runner1018
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I (all in our 40's and 50's) stayed here as part of an escorted tour of Italy. The hotel was very nice in many ways. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We had two rooms on two different floors. The room on the lower floor was large with a large bathroom, but the room on the 5th floor was tiny with a very small bathroom. Even though I was in the tiny room, it was comfortable and clean. We tried to think of it as charming! The hotel is very convenient to the train station. It's a little bit of a walk to St. Mark's square, but I don't see a problem with that...it's a good way to see Venice! The breakfast was the best we had in all of Italy - especially the yogurt! The hotel wasn't perfect, but I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, good breakfast, on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: lisaann1065
Reviews.Content: Hotel was okay, but not great. We did not pay the extra 65 euros a day for a view of grand canal, so no view worth mentioning. Staff was nice. Ice machine available in hall. We stayed in 5 other hotels on our trip, and this is the only place that had ice...I like ice. Room was small, but clean. I wish our room was ready when we got there. After traveling for almost an entire day, we were tired and dirty and dying to take a shower. We arrived at 11:30 am and they did hold our luggage and told us to come back at 2:00 pm. We returned at 2:15 and had to wait about another 30 minutes before our room was ready.

Reviews.Title: “convenient to train station”
Reviews.Author: Cynak
Reviews.Content: Pluses: On the Grand canal. Convenient to train station. Decent size room. Decent view. Minus: Not convenient to San Marco Square ( which is where everything is happening). Sort of haughty front desk staff. Stupid WiFi policy (hourly passwords)

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: tyetaylor
Reviews.Content: We booked our room after having a look at the photos on the hotel's website. The lobby was very nice and welcoming, but our room was a different story. The room did not remotely resemble the ones on the website, and our window overlooked an alley filled with rubbish. The staff were rude when we asked them if there were any other rooms available. However the room was clean and the breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelmesa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 times in this hotel & it is the best we can find for the money & location. It is one block from the train station & convenient to all the vaparetto stations. The last time we arrived in Venice, walked out of the airport & onto the water taxi about a block away, then 30 minutes later we arrived at the Principe on the Grand Canal where the porter greeted us & took our bags. When I went to check us in the hotel manager informed me that I had booked the Hotel Principe in "Rome". After all night on the plane I was in shock, but he assured me that he would work it out & called the Rome hotel & got him to wave the one night penalty then sent us to some much needed rooms for a good rest. This was more than I would have expected from most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - you're in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Inger95
Reviews.Content: It surprised us, it had everything: Locaction, outlooking the channel and the activities, close to the railway station and bus terminal. Wonderful terrace, romantic, sunny.... perfect for a glas of prosecco High standard - nice rooms with air condition Delicous breakfast Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, clean room in great location”
Reviews.Author: LRC30
Reviews.Content: While I admittedly only spent a couple of days in Venice, based on my short time there, I found the hotel to be conveniently located near plenty of shops, restaurants, and a waterbus stop. We took a water taxi from Marco Polo Airport directly to the hotel, but the hotel is also near the train station and Ferrovia vaporetto stop, which are other transportation options. My room was as spacious as I would have anticipated for Italy; in other words quaint by U.S. standards, but I would never expect a large hotel room over there. The shower was slightly claustrophobic, but served its purpose. We were also pleasantly surprised to find out that we had a double bed. The room had a small balcony that overlooked a busy alleyway, which got a little noisy at times, but was tolerable from the third floor. There was also a lovely terrace down the corridor, which had a great view of the Grand Canal. Most importantly though, my room was clean. We were fortunate enough to be on an escorted tour with an Italian tour guide, so I personally had very few interactions with the front desk or hotel staff, but everyone seemed friendly and helpful enough. My only small complaint would be that the AC unit above our door was constantly leaking condensation onto the nightstand near where I slept. It also leaked on us every time we stepped out the door, but this wasn't that big of a deal. I am not a very seasoned traveler and haven't stayed at many other hotels in Europe, but I definitely enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “At the Principe, Shift Happens”
Reviews.Author: noli123
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, the guy at the front desk told me that there was a 'technical glitch,' and I was mistakenly booked into their sister hotel down the street. A pretty lame excuse for giving my room to someone else. They didn't offer to compensate me for the inconvenience by, for example, upgrading my room for a lower price. The sister hotel was okay, but not on the canal. I learned from another couple staying there that they had been shifted from the Principe too. At the Principe, 'Shift Happens.' Beware.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever for us travelers”
Reviews.Author: 5173park
Reviews.Content: i planned this trip to venice, italy for the past year with a travel agent whom booked the principi hotel for 2 nights prior to the cruise and 1 night after the cruise. i reviewed the website for the hotel prinicipi daily reviewing pictures etc and when i arrived it did not look like the pics on the internet-- especially the room a old dusty feel to it, however i pretended to smile because my 10 yo daughter was there and did not ruin her esperience. the most heartbreaking thing for my was the staff at the principi was beyond rude-- i can't quit tell whether it was because iam african american or an american citizen that caused the tension, but i felt very vulnerable in a strange countyr with the hotel staff unwillingness to even help me get a porter to transfer me to the airport at 4am-- the manager told me i was only a guest there to sleep in the hotel and they would not assist me with anything else.. i was so upset that i asked for the number for the american embassy because they continued to shrug there sholders and act as if they could not understand or speak english.. can you imagine being with your 10 yo child alone in a foreign country and the only people to help you is the hotel staff to help advocate and assist you all of sudden act as if they don't speak english!! it was a horrifying experience.. i had to walk to meet the shuttle and cross a huge bridge with my 10yo and 2 pieces of luggage at 3am-- the principi staff did not care ven though they promote their hotel as having a privae landing for water boats-- they offered for me to pay the driver 40 euros to take me to the airport.. if you are traveling to italy and do not know the language--italian-- then do not travel there-- the ruins of italy is beatiful, however the people makes the exprience not worth it.. again steer clear of this hotel they do not like or value you as a customer..

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Amberree
Reviews.Content: The room was not fit for a human. No windows, just 2 sky lights .Had to climb on the furniture to close the shutters on the skylights. I could not stand up in bathtub/shower because the ceiling was so low and I am only 5'4" tall. I along with 2 other friends who stayed in a different room got a bad rash on our legs from either their sheets or something else in the hotel. Hotel and restaurant staff very rude. There is internet service for 60 euros/day.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location,, would be back”
Reviews.Author: U3
Reviews.Content: lovely terrace so you can breakfast on the canal, this hotel has water bus stops nearby also near train and landbus stations . the staff are very helpful . we stayed here for 1 night after our med cruise as it was near the allilaguna stop for the airport. lots of restaurants and shops nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location.”
Reviews.Author: DDDBS5
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of Globus Tour "Best of Italy". The hotel is on the Grand Canal and you can sit outside with a glass of wine and watch Venice go by. Tons of shops and restaurants right in the area. Bed comfortable. Nice bathroom. We did't have a view of anything. Poor AC. Glad it was not hot at night.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: wonsport
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to many hotels during our trip and this hotel was far worse than any other hotel. The check-in was smooth and the hotel lobby was very clean and nice which brought our expectations of the room higher. However as we entered the room, the room is nothing close to nice. It has a antique style to it but to us it just looked old and dirty. The shower was dirty and wouldn't drain enough and would create a miniature Venice canal in the room if not careful. Yet, this still didn't disappoint us that much because we have stayed at a 2-3 star hotel in the past and had worse. The point that completely ruined our stay was that they served beef to our friends from India. They ordered chicken and repeatedly specified they didn't want beef. They served the meal stating that it is chicken but after the first bite, the family realized that it was beef. Aside to the crying family, the servers stated that it was chicken. But then after talking with them, they admitted it that it was cattle meat. With no apology they removed the plate. Furious, I asked for the manager. After a while he came up the us and just said "Do you want to eat fish?" Just horrible service and ruined our Venice trip. I would never stay at the hotel and wouldn't recommend this hotel to any travelers. I created an account at tripadvisor just to state how horrible this hotel was. That is how much I didn't enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in spring 2011 for three nights. Based on online feedback and recommendations from our travel agent we booked this place. And what a great choice it was in the end! We arrived in the middle of the afternoon by train. This Hotel is just a five minute walk away from the train station. So you won't need a water taxi and you don't need to walk through the whole town either with your luggage. It's beautifully located right on the Canal (Canale Grande). The lobby was welcoming and the staff (especially front desk) really friendly. Check-In and Check-Out were only a matter of seconds. The room wasn't that big (we only booked a standard), but really clean. The bathroom impressed us very much (nice size and super-clean). The room also had some small table, a pretty big closet and a small flatscreen. The bed was comfortable and the hotel itself very quiet. We had a really good sleep here. A great breakfast is included. Any kind of hot or cold breakfast food....nice! During the breakfast you can watch the canale, if you're lucky and have a front-window table. Only five minutes away is the next vaporetto (the "water-bus") station. So you can get anywhere in no time. And if you chose to walk it's only about 25 minutes away from Piazza San Marco. We really couldn't have been happier with this Hotel. It really went beyond our expectations. And all of this for a really fair price! When we come back, we surely will stay here again! Wanna know more about my trips? Check my profile or visit: route66traveler.jimdo.com

Reviews.Title: “Attrocious service from Reception”
Reviews.Author: fintyflanagan
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, we thought it a great location, great food in restaurant both for breakfast and evening meal. The staff in the restaurant and the porters were fantastic and the room very clean. The staff behind reception were obnoxious dismissing us every time we asked anything. They didn't pass on a fax telling us that our transfer had been changed - critical in a city like Venice. Shrugged their shoulders twice and only thanks to the porter did anything get done.

Reviews.Title: “Living in Style”
Reviews.Author: sanjay_datta
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel for our stay at Venice. The hotel is 5 min walking from Santa Lucia train station and you donot have to cross the bridge.. The hotel is on thebanks of Grand canal and is furnished with elegantly tasted furnitures from the Victorian era. Some of the rooms have attached balconies overlooking the Grand canal. Rooms are decent, airconditioned having satellite TV facilities and chargeable internet connection. Free wifi is available at lobby. It has an excellent bar where boarder can sip fine Italialian wine while watching the gondollas, water taxis and water boats ferrying the canal. Restuarant at hotel serves wide varities of cuisine. The hotel is conviniently located is accessible to all major locations of Venice by walking or riding water taxi or water bus. Trips by gondollas are very costly and is the cheaper version is water boats. One can go in for a Venice pass which proves chaeper communication. . Staffs are friendly andhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Hyacinthstoke
Reviews.Content: Went for a 4 day trip, found the hotel straight away, location was perfect. Didn't have an evening meal but was told it was fanatastic. Breakfast though we did have and it was just scrummy, scrambled eggs just divine, croissants were the best I've had, munching them overlooking the Great Canal awesome. Room was adequate for our needs just the right size. Only downer was the water running cool and at the moment a little work being completed. Would I go back ? Oh yeah !!

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, well kept and comfortable"”
Reviews.Author: Rouanez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the train and bus stations in Venice. To top it all it is on the Grand Canal very near 3 vaporetto stops giving you direct access to anywhere in Venice, Murano, the Lido... Despite its unique location, it is quiet and its entrance has nothing ostentatious. Their first priced rooms are comfortable, clean and quiet. Breakfast room on the Grand Canal. Good self-serve breakfast and restaurant at night with quite an expensive menu ( 30 euros) Lots of restaurants nearby with reasonable prices. Especially a self serve one where Venitian families come :-) Just a detail though: Some of their bathrooms in their best priced rroms don't allow you to take a shower without bumping your head on the celing :-(

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to remember”
Reviews.Author: stephaniecini
Reviews.Content: In August i have been to this hotel and we were lucky that me and my friends got the room in front of the canal... we had a big room with two bathrooms and we were very satisfied about it. An excellent view to enjoy from the two balconies we had it was relaxing...though the canal smelled ackward... Staff politeness should be improved as some of the staff were rude....but after all was worth as we could reach all shops in the area...

Reviews.Title: “Clean & tastefully decorated”
Reviews.Author: aitenshi
Reviews.Content: Positives: Close to train station Within walking distance to Realto bridge, St. Mark's Square & Doge's palace Has nice views of the canals Room are tastefully decorated & clean Lots of shops & restaurants right around hotel Negatives: Rooms are on the small side but hey this is Venice. Breakfast buffet a bit on the average side.

Reviews.Title: “booking confirmed but hotel was closed”
Reviews.Author: profecto
Reviews.Content: I would like to review the Principe but on this trip to Venice we haven't been able to stay there. We stayed at the Principe twice before and booked to stay there again but when we arrived the hotel was closed and a notice directed us to the Amadeus a little further down the Lista di Spagna. We are told the Prinicpe is closed for renovations. We would not have stayed at the Amadeus - it had been reviewed unfavourably, and we specifically wanted to stay at the Principe for sentimental reasons. We have two rooms - one is OK but the other is very small and definitely not of the standard we were used to at the Principe. Also the dining room of the Principe looks out on the Grand Canal but the Amadeus is not on the canal. I have just checked the Principe web site and there is nothing there to say there are closed. This is blatantly deceptive advertising. Also as I sit here in the lobby of the Amadeus to use the internet there is the strong smell of cigarette smoke. When we checked in I asked for non-smoking rooms and was told the whole hotel is non-smoking but there is an ashtray on the desk in my room. All vvery disappointing. NOT HAPPY!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling staff”
Reviews.Author: Michelle196904
Reviews.Content: Good location near train station. Breakfast fantastic. Rooms ok and clean but all the good points are soon forgotten due to the appalling service and attitude of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Venice-Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TheCouchSurfer
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay here, nice staff, perfect location for the train and a really good breakfast buffet included in the price. I have stayed in a lot of European hotels and this one had the biggest bathroom I have ever seen in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to train, Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: jbp19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of Gate 1's Enchanting Italy tour in October 2010. The hotel was located on the Grand Canal which was great, and there was a mooring which made transfers from the airport easy. The hotel was a quick walk from the train station, and was surrounded by restaurants, souvenir shops, and gelaterias. It was quite a long walk to Piazza San Marco, but there are vaporetto stops nearby as a faster alternative. Our room was average, our window looked out into an interior walled shaft, but we didn't spend too much time in the room. The bathroom was quite large, and the safe worked, had some trouble closing/locking room door. The breakfast was a large spread, but very busy and hard to secure seating.

Reviews.Title: “Venice, Italy - magical”
Reviews.Author: KashaPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: I returned from an Italian "Best of Italy" tour through Globus with Igor Spinnelli as our regional tour director- 9/15/10 to 9/25/10. I say regional as the local tours were all by different local guides. I pick Venice as I felt so giggly and young again upon walking over the bridge into Venice and seeing the water "Streets" and way of life so very different than anything I have ever seen. I enjoyed the entire tour of Italy and there is no bad location, each destination has its own unique footprint. We had a bit of luck in Venice in that our hotel room looked out onto the Grand Canal. We stayed in the Venice Principe on the first floor. Oh my goodness - how exciting to have the view of the Grand Canal. Dinner was not included on 9/20/10 so we found a grocery store in Venice, purchased a cooked pizza, wine, appetizer and dessert - returned to our room - opened the windows and proceeded to watch traffic as we ate dinner. In writing this I suppose this could sound quite strange. Really - who watches traffic while eating dinner on purpose and for fun? Rhetorical question there. The Principe hotel staff were delightful and helpful. The hotel room comfortable, clean and the view spectacular. We had three windows from the bedroom and one from the bathroom. Deep silled windows allowed you to put your drink/food down to take more pictures The view again, amazing even from the bathroom. One of our friends overslept and her luggage was late getting out for pickup, well the male hotel staff responsible for taking the luggage saw she was upset at oversleeping, he started to sing to her. It was wonderful to watch as with his singing he attempted to calm her down. Also in Venice we took a Gondola ride. The Gondola ride was relaxing and most enjoyable although I sneezed (somewhat loud) and startled our driver who made a comment - I have no idea what the comment was however the tone of his voice made me laugh and I had the shoulder/body shakes which probably didn't help him to steer. He did great though. St, Marks square and Basilica is remarkable, lovely and fascinating. The history is amazing. We toured Dogeâ€™s palace, Murano glass factory, the Bridge of Sigh's and had a boat ride over to Burano for lunch and shopping. Looking back it went all so fast. I would love to return, and slowly walk the paved streets going in and out of shops, take another gondola ride and stay at the Principe with the room with a view to the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for the Train”
Reviews.Author: SueG77
Reviews.Content: It is a very old hotel which you can really feel in the small rooms and hard beds. It is very convienient for the train station, there are a lot of hotels that are located down narrow alleys which we would have never found whereas this one is on the main street a very short distance from the station. I would not suggest eating at the restaurant. Our server was very nice and brought an unexpected seafood starter for us to try that we didn't order and it ended up on our bill, I also ordered a medium steak which came out blue rare and then when I sent it back to be cooked longer I ended up with it only as rare. The food overall was nothing special and were not worth the price we paid, we would have enjoyed a pizza down the street a lot more. Everyone there was very friendly. This hotel will be good if location if important to you and you are not planning on spending a lot of time there. I would stay here again if it were only for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCanuck
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay, easy walk to train station, good rooms, veryvery small showers. TV worked inconsistently, staff helpful, slow elevators, we waked mostly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Old World Style,lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: Shimshon
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice in August 2010, wonderful location, within walking distance of everything, wonderful Old World style including great breakfast and wonderful canal views, the staff were good especially Paulo there are 3 Paulos!

Reviews.Title: “Nice public areas, horrid rooms”
Reviews.Author: AussieSharon
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the nice pictures on their web site! I saw several rooms at this property and were less than impressed with any of them, ours was tiny with a very small bathroom and a shower you could not raise your elbows in, a large person would not even be able to get into it. and our room had a strange smell as did some of the others. We were on a tour and each member of our group had a slightly different room, some tiny, others more spacious, some had a nice but shabby decor but most of our group were unhappy with them. Having said that, it has lovely public areas and the breakfast was the best of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy. The staff were OK. Overall I would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Awful !!”
Reviews.Author: rajeevclassic
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the net are inspiring...but wait until you check in and it is a terrible experience...the staff downright rude, the air conditioning is non functional, the decor is gloomy and dated, the carpets filthy, just who gave them a four star rating ?? Anywhere else it would struggle to get a three star, just not worth the money paid. avoid this hotel or ruin your holiday !!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel oozing Italian elegance and style.”
Reviews.Author: EddieandLynn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights at the Principe and we loved it. This classy hotel sits nicely on one of the most glamorous and spectacular high streets in the world â€“ the Grand Canal. All the staff were great. The bellboy carried our suitcases straight out of the water-taxi and into our room. The room was spotlessly clean, the shower was good and there was also a small bathtub. We didnâ€™t pay for a balcony or a canal view but we were pleasantly surprised to find that not only could we see the canal but also the bell tower of St Markâ€™s (in the centre of the picture.) Lynn just happened to be leaning out of the bathroom window at the time, yeah well okay, we copied it from the excellent photo by, â€œasample.â€� We bought a 36-hour waterbus pass for about 23 Euros and used it a lot. We still walked for miles in temperatures approaching 40C and when we got back to our room, hot and tired, it was like walking into a fridge, the air-con was fantastic. The dining room is really good with its pristine white chairs and outside sitting area. The breakfast was good and had just about everything including bacon and eggs. We never had dinner in the hotel but had quite a few drinks in the Marco Polo Bar, which is reasonably priced for the Grand Canal. The main street through the Cannaregio area is lively and quite good for shopping, and you can get a decent bottle of Chianti for 6.50 at the Brek snack bar, which also does very cheap food. Downside. The room could have been bigger, it only had one wardrobe and the carpets could do with changing throughout the whole hotel. Apart from that, the Principe exceeded our expectations, especially after reading some of these reviews, but hey, Venice is exciting, unique and breathtakingly beautiful so you donâ€™t spend too much time in the hotel anyway. But itâ€™s great to have a good one on the Canal Grande near the waterbus stop. We had a great time and would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated rooms but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisandGina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Principe with a Globus family tour. Our room was dark with very outdated decor. Hotel lobby was spacious and comfortable and staff was efficient but not overly friendly. Outdoor tables on canal provided a nice view and we enjoyed the location of the hotel as there was very reasonable shopping as well as outdoor fruit/food stands. Location was also convenient to the Ferro Via stop for public transport (No one checks for tickets, but buy them anyway and watch for gypsy children who are more African than stereotypically Adriatic and also work in groups.)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Expensive, Shabby, needs a facelift !”
Reviews.Author: lisak1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Principe for 2 nights after a Cruise around the Greek Islands for our Honeymoon. When we arrived early on the first day, our room was not ready so we were told we could leave our bags and go sightseeing our room would be ready on our return and that we had been upgraded to a room with a view. We returned late in the evening and arrived back to the hotel and were escorted to the old elevator, passed the halls with the torn wallpaper, the stained carpet to "our room with a view" ...... it was the smallest room we stayed in during out stay in Italy... we had a small balcony which was covered in dirt, the paint was peeling off the shutters and there was bird dirt all over the table on the balcony. The room itself was small, old fashioned, 70's style, but the linens and towels were clean and changed everyday. Breakfast was fine too. I know Venice is an old city, but this hotel needs a facelift. There was a nice view of the canal but the balcony was so shabby and dirty you were not encouraged to sit out there. I would not recommend the place for anyone... not to mention Honeymooners....We are also supposed to get a Welcome drink and fruit basket, but this never arrived either. We contacted our travel agent on our return to advise that they might re-consider recommending this hotel to anyone. Seriously there has to be better value for money in Venice ? A good point is that it is near the train & bus station so that you can leave the place quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful buffet breakfasts, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: HopalongKent
Reviews.Content: We were recommended by a friend and it was even better than expected, lovely, clean hotel, overlooking Grand Canal, buffet breakfasts with good choices of food and good quality of food too. Our room, and our friends room was rather small with no view, but we were there for a long weekend so we did not mind. Very clean room and shower room, linen all changed daily. We ate nearby, where there were good choices of places to eat, and had the most expensive meal on our last night at the hotel, but excellent service, when you add up what was included, not such bad value after all. We had a water taxi from airport to pier, booked independently, what a way to arrive and depart. Coffee and tea making facilities might have been helpful, and some of the reception staff could have looked a bit happier, but a minor detail to mention. On the whole, excellent. Would recommend, and would love to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel, staff, and food were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: MrsP03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Principe in Venice two days before boarding a ship to tour the Greek Isles. We were given the Honeymoom Suite, as we were celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary. It was absolutely beautiful with beautiul furnishings and a great bed. The staff was wonderful. Ready and willing to make our stay the best ever. The food was outstanding. We absolutely loved the breakfast. Our room had two balconies that faced the Grand Canal. We have nothing negative to say about our stay. Would definately stay again and hope to do so soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, and loved Venice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wearytrvlr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a short walk from the train station. The rear doors open to a lovely seating area with tables and chairs, and faces the Grand Canal. It was easy to get to the waterbus stop from here, as well as find our way back when wandering around. We walked from St. Mark's once, and took a water taxi with a group once. Rooms are spacious and clean, with lovely linens. Bathroom was large, and well laid out. Internet access wasn't included, but can be purchased for the day or by the hour. breakfast was delicious, and plentiful. I loved this hotel, and can't wait to return to Venice! I didn't need the assistance of the hotel staff, or front desk, except to pay for internet access when checking out. That took some time. BUT, I certainly would return here!

Reviews.Title: “some good some bad”
Reviews.Author: mariliana99
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in the best location of venice I stay in this hotel in 1997 and it is very good but now all the rooms are very old and dont have the qualities. i dont like the brakfast is very poor. the hotel is very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Wow , what a hotel for the price !!!”
Reviews.Author: John-manassas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within a 5 minute walk of the train station. The front of the hotel has balconies overlooking the walking strip into Venice ( nice views ) and the back of the hotel is on the Grand canal ( nice views ). The interior of the main lobby is exceptional. Clean, well lit with multiple chandiliers , Nice furnishing , nice dining area and bar. Very plush. The breakfast is a full breakfast with scrambled eggs , bacon etc...very good . The staff was nice and helpfull. My wife and mother in law just Loved the place. The rooms are spotless , well decorated and large enough. The bathrooms are modern and clean. The only little glitch was that when we arrived they offered a "free" private tour to Murano..Nice right. The water taxi picked us up and took us to Murano as promised. It dropped us off at a glass factory and we got the tour. Truthfully I kinda felt a bit of pressure to buy something ( very expensive glass factory ). All thats good , but we had to arrange a way back from the island on our own...The cheapest public water taxi back is 6.50 euros each..so 32 euros for the 5 of us. Al in all this is a great hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Principe”
Reviews.Author: lawclerk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our cruise line as a pre-vacation stay prior to boarding the ship the next day. There were 4 of us and neither couple was disappointed. What a wonderful hotel. Rooms were clean, bathroom was spotless and modern. We had a room overlooking the grand canal and the other couple had their own terrace overlooking the street. I would love to return to this hotel. The location was great. Just take the #1 vaparetto around to St.Mark's (purchase a round trip ticket) and you can't go wrong. Oh, and the breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valbres
Reviews.Content: It's really lovely, right on the Grand Canal, easy walk from the train station. The dining room overlooks the Canal--what a view! Wonderful breakfast buffet, too. Absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AssiaMoscow
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Very close to station, it is a little to reach far to Piazza San Marco. We reserved room DBL+exbed. But when us have resulted in room, I with surprise have seen that there only the double bed and a room is small for TRL.Ð�Ð¾ my question where an additional bed, the porter has put forward from below from under a bed an additional added bed! It was necessary to go on reseption to explain that our child already GRANDE to sleep on such bed. Fortunately, they have understood at once my discontent and have given us a key from other room which has appeared suite! It was the pleasant surprise for New year! Suite consists of two small, but separate rooms, in each of which the TV with a prefix for the Internet (which all 2 days did not work).Ð’ our room was also a small balcony with a kind on Lista Spagna. The breakfast passes in beautifully issued dining room with a kind on the Grand Canale - perfectly! A breakfast very good, with a tasty omelette and fine coffee. We were in Venice just during flooding and the hotel had some difficulties because of it is a street door leaving on Grand Canale, has been blocked from water (though water all the same got inside) and the exit from hotel on Lista Spagna was carried out in the mornings only on the added bridge. But in Venice it is wonderful always and we almost did not test inconveniences! (I think that about employees of hotel of it it is impossible to tell).Ð£ us remained very good Ð²Ð¾Ð¿Ñ€Ð¾Ð¼Ð¸Ð½Ð°Ð½Ð¸Ñ� from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great location!”
Reviews.Author: katelynsandon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our extended Italy vacation and absolutly loved this hotel. I would recommend it to any American traveler. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms are quite large. Half of the rooms overlook the canal and the other half overlook the city streets of Venice. This was the best hotel during our trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WSLLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location near the bus & train stations, and all sights are easily accessible on foot. The bad point about this hotel was reception staff (not very friendly or helpful) and the bathroom (we only had a shower cubicle which is fine in itself but it took ages to get the right temperature and then it went hot and cold on its own accord!) The walls are also quite thin as we could hear the guests in the next room. Breakfast was good, reasonable choice and a nice dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service. Fabulous breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Smith_and_Kendon
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were overwhelmed by the high quality of the interior design. A most luxurious feel. The reception staff were extremey helpful, and spoke perfect English when my faltering Italian ran out! Initially we were given a twin rather than double room owing to a booking mix-up but they moved us to a double room straight away when we asked. Comfortable room & ensuite bathroom. A little on the small side but fine for two. Breakfasts were a joy every morning. Huge selection, and vast quantities of everything. This became our main meal of the day! Eating breakfast in the luxurious dining room overlooking the canal was a wonderful start to the day. We would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “good location,room and servive very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: raymondNewYork
Reviews.Content: the location was good but the room was very small and musty.the staff needs training in good customer service.they were not at all friendly and at times almost rude.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 Location”
Reviews.Author: watty77
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well postioned next to all the transport services & on the Grand Canal. Check in & check out were effortless & the marble reception area was beautiful. Our room overlooked the Grand-Canal & was clean & comfortable. The bathroom was clean but had a musty smell. It had a good shower with plenty of hot water & nice fluffy towels. The air con worked well & was always very welcome after the hot sunshine. Breakfast was self service & very good. My Husband enjoyed the coffee machine Which ground the beans warmed your cup & had loads of gizmo buttons to press !!! He-hee The hotel is well placeed next to lots of bars & eateries. ( from cheap & cheerful to exclusive ) THANK YOU to all the staff for a very enjoyable stay xxxx

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: europe09Adelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and were really looking forward to our time in Venice, The location was good being close to the station and the vaporetto nearby. The rooms were large but very tired and musty smelling, no fly screens on windows allowing mosiquitos in the room, when we told reception about our problem they said they would advise house keeping to keep the window shut - however returned to our room to find it full of mosquitos again. The restaurant served a reasonable breakfast and an adequete dinner. There are lots of other restaurants nearby, which we sampled on the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious; save your money and find something better for less.”
Reviews.Author: bikenkayak_Al
Reviews.Content: Near the train station and directly on the grand canal with its own dock. But that's not enough to justify $300+ per night for a cramped room they call standard. High tech HVAC did not work; we had to call the front desk to turn the A/C on, then off (no thermostatic controls). It took two calls and a personal visit to the front desk to get help with the luggage on check out day. Breakfast was undistinguished. And watch out for the complimentary boat trip to the Murano factory; you could get stuck with a costly water taxi ride to get home. We have traveled extensively throughout Europe and have a good sense of value. Skip this place and get more charm, service, and quality at a lower cost.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: galfromMD
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed here for four nights. The hotel is a bit of a walk from the Guglie stop so if you have a lot of luggage, this may be a problem. But it is not far from the train station and ferry so that was great for getting around. We loved this hotel. The room we booked was small so we asked for an upgrade, which we got for an additional 60 Euro per night. They let us see the room first. We loved it, well worth the extra money. Roomy, newly renovated, large remodeled bathroom, small balcony with canal view, couldn't have asked for more. The front desk and restaurant staff were more than friendly and helpful. The bartender Giovanni was the best, giving advice on drinks and sights. I will definitely stay here again. We were sad to find out the last night we were there that they don't automatically add tips to the dinners billed to the room - so unfair to the nice staff! There is no line on bills to write in a tip so we just assumed it was there. If I ever get back to Venice, I will stay here again. I have a mild muscular disorder so the elevator was essential for me. Not many hotels have them so be sure to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Small/ Old Rooms but Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Claudia_KM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 3-5 mins walk from the hotel which is great. We have reserve for double bed but when we reach there we don't have the room we want. Reception keep changing the room for 3 times until we got our room. Well they are helpful, but they should know which room is which from the very beginning. Our room is very small compare to Rome & Milan Hotels we visited. We didn't expect much from Venice Hotels as most of them are really small and old. We have seen 3 rooms there and all are different even though the same rate. Floor 5th is the worst if you have big luggage, 'cos the elevator goes until 4th and the rest is walking up the stairs. We only pick this hotel 'cos of the location which is easy to go around in Venice. The Breakfast here is nice.. selection of breads, cereals, sausages & eggs, selection of fruits & cheese, Selection of teas & coffee. I would recommend if you like the hotel that is close to the station and ferries. Plus if you are going to do more of the sightseeing that being inside the hotel this one is not that bad. There are alot of restaurant nearby and are very lively the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfan725
Reviews.Content: The Principe is very disappointing and barely a 2 star, certainly not a 4 star hotel. My room was small and shabby with peeling paint, a badly working air conditioner, and just an unclean feel to it. Worst of all, I woke up one night with bug bites which I can only assume were from bedbugs! Additionally, the room had one lock which seemed insecure and worried me the whole time I was there. The staff, with the exception of the canal-side bar was indifferent. This place had the feel of a marginal budget hotel. While it is well located on the Grand Canal, that is the only good thing I can stay about it. Don't make my mistake - don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoneshB
Reviews.Content: Close to the Station. Good restaurants nearby. Close to the Water Bus / Taxi Station. Very Small bathrooms.
