Reviews.Title: “not so beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: smile220
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, old and not really airconditioned. Changed rooms 3 times because the air conditioning was not up to par and the front desk said Americans always complain they like it cold. I just wanted the room to be cool. Rooms are really dingy and smelly The location is great because it is a minute walk from the train station. The breakfast is superb with many choices and a very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “No More Next Time”
Reviews.Author: Koeey
Reviews.Content: We are family of 4 from HK, we have booked a cruise holiday started from Venice in July. We have booked 2 rooms in Principe Hotel for the pre-cruise night. We have travelled almost 20 hours from HKG. The weather was hot and we were tired. Upon we check-in the hotel, the receptionist told us the hotel was full, we had to move to another hotel nearby which is only a min away. We were not happy and insisted to have our own choice of hotel, if the rooms were fully booked why they still confirmed the booking with our travel agent!!! Then a Manager came and said he was in the middle of a meeting and told us the hotel was full. ( I noticed that he came out from a restaurant opposit to the hotel main entrance) . He offered us some welcome drinks instead. We refused the 'Welcome Drinks' and strongly insisted to stay in Principe. So the manager told us to compare the rooms between Principe and the other one's. We were very angry and were directed to 2 horrible rooms in Principe (hot and no decoration inside) , my husband went with their staff to the hotel they offered and didn't like the rooms too. I asked the manager's name, but in return he asked me 'WHY', (what a so called 4 stars hotel), I asked for his name card he didn't give to me, he asked me what have I decided (Impossible!!) I said to him that I decided to get his name card and we only wanted our original booking since we have travelled a long journey from HKG. After struggled for alsmot an hour, I got his name card and 2 rooms with cool air to rest. This is not a very good experience. However I think we are lucky in choosing our cruise holiday with Royal Caribbean not an Italian cruise company. No more in Principe Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, decadent environment, no sex appeal place”
Reviews.Author: MilitoHK
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very convenient if you arrive by train (2 minutes walk from Santa Lucia railway station). This hotel is 4-star rated, but as many other hotels in Venice, those stars are virtual ones: from the status of maintenance of common areas (worn-out carpet floor etc.) this place is nothing remotely close to a real 4-star hotel. For 110 Euro/night (including breakfast) this place is a fair deal. Concierge staff can be very cordial, but I have seen guest being addressed very rudely by the concierge staff on the following shift. Definitively a place worth to consider for convenient and no-frills stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scholnicks
Reviews.Content: Principe is conveniently located close to the train station and a vaporetti stop right on the grand canal. It is showing its age. The carpets are little worn in places. The staff was very helpful with questions. The rooms are somewhat small and the bathroom was quite small. They have a decent breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel which lived up to its rating and standards.”
Reviews.Author: ukVictoriaTaunton
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Principe hotel and were most impressed with our room. On arrival were pleasantly surprised and delighted to have been allocated a junior suite which made the holiday for us. The room had two juliet balconies, one with a side view of the canal and the other looking onto the street below. The windows were sound proofed so once they were closed you could hear no noise from outside at all. The cleanliness of the hotel was first class, the bedding and towels changed daily and the breakfast very good with good choice of cereals ,fresh fruit, fruit juices assortment of breads and pastries plus the best bacon and eggs we've tasted throughout the many holidays we've had in europe over the years. The situation of the hotel is excellently based for the train, bus station and water taxis etc. We'll certainly be staying at the Principe on our next visit to venice as it most definitely lives up to it's 4 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Right on the Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlaj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights over Easter weekend. We loved the fact that it was so close to the train station, the water bus station, and the first bridge over the Grand Canal. It is a long walk to St. Mark's square, but we were happy to be further away as that area was PACKED with people! We didn't mind the walk and even enjoyed getting lost on the confusing streets. :) We stayed in a junior suite on the first floor overlooking the Grand Canal. The room was huge (2 separate areas) and 2 bathrooms! A big change from our other tiny rooms in Italy. I loved opening the windows and watching the busy canal. Beautiful room!!! We would stay here again as the hotel has a convenient location, clean, comfortable rooms, and a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: callmesam
Reviews.Content: Great location on the Grand Canal, nice lobby, pleasant staff. Our room was pretty awful, tho, very shabby with water stains on one of the pictures hanging on the wall, peeling plaster, cracks in the tile floor in the bathroom. Definitely not a four star room. We should have given them a chance to change our room but once we were unpacked we didn't want to go to the trouble of moving. A lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “good to remember”
Reviews.Author: GCC73
Reviews.Content: just returned. initially booked for gardena, but referred to their sister-hotel, principe. although not great view from the room, just over the main street, room and most of what i've seen in the hotel clean. great breakfast, good service. brilliant location, easy access to public transportation to all directions - good transport hub.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: WTW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to reach from Venice Marco Polo. We took the water bus Orange Line (Line #1) to Guglie stop (2nd stop) and then you get off, walk about 500 mtrs, turn right and cross overtop of bridge you see directly in front of you from the bus stop From there keep walking straight (or as straight as you can down the meandering foot alley of shops and stores, about 2-3 min walk tops) and Hotel Principe main entry is on your left hand side. Really nice to arrive quickly without much hassle at this hotel after long overnight flights. This was one of my concerns was ending up walking for a long distance once off the stop. So location is great. If coming from the train station you turn left out of train station and walk straight down footpath about 2 minutes. The hotel has a water taxi stop out front. We didnâ€™t notice much taxi business (cars or water taxis) on departure from the airport to here. Despite many online sites offering water taxis at 190 euros one-way, there is a depot at the airport where you can pick up the water taxis for 95euro one-way. Water bus (roundtrip was 25 euro/pers). Not bad, takes about 25 mins to get into town due to slowwwwww speeds, canal is shallow enroute to Venice Island so speeds kept a bit slower to avoid grounding out. Hotel also offers free tours to Murano island glass factories if you so desire to go there. Hotels nearby: Hotel Zecchini, Bellini, Dei Dogi, Hotel Nazionale and Hotel Belle Eopque. Hotel Adua (think its closed), Guerrini, Continental We had a superior double (2 twins pretty much always make a double in Italy), overlooking the alleyway of markets and shops down below. Obviously canal view are next price level, but there is non-stop movement on the canal day and until about 10pm, so choose your location wisely. Windows are very soundproof, only could hear foot traffic below if you open your window, otherwise completely silent. I am certain this would be the same on the canal side also. Room is quite ample size compared to some Iâ€™ve stayed in during visits to Italy and Europe. Bathroom, while sparkling clean was on the small side (take out the bidet maybe!!, move the toilet and have a full size shower/bath rather than a corner shower stall. Just a thought) Breakfast was good, with lots of meats/cheezes, cereals, grapefruit & orange juice, and frizzante water (sparkling) also coffees and teas. Fresh fruits to choose from, plain and fruit, yogurt. Internet cost: Internet on TV (24 unlimited use: 6 euros), Internet on laptop (1 hour: 6 euros), 24 hours: 15 euros, and 24 hours internet and 24 hours unlimited movies: 25 euros. Downside: Beds had minimal blankets and we found the room COLD most days in Feb (while we were in Venice for Carnival). Turning on heat wouldnâ€™t work in last 2 days as it would stay on only 10 minutes max) Today took the water bus (Line #1) down to St Marks Square and Doges Palace then walked to Bridge of Sighs. Then walked back to Rialto Bridge (takes 15 minutes by map). From Rialto Bridge to Hotel Principe takes 25 minutes (leisurely walk). Would recommend taking the bus line down and cruise the grand canal as its very pretty/picturesque seeing all the houses and gondolas. Cost 6.50euro per way for #1 line, or 13 euro roundtrip. 12 hour cost 16 euro, and 24 cost 18 euro. Marco Polo Bar: Nice smallish room with interior room as well. Venice to Treviso airport. Buses run from Piazzale Roma which is just past the train station and over the bridge, maybe about 6 minutes walk from the Hotel Principe. Bus run time from Piazzale Roma to Treviso is about 50 minutes. Cost (6 euro per person) Buses also run from Marco Polo airport (Blue buses) Front desk staff are wonderfully helpful, offering maps and directions, as well as warm cannoli (sweets) upon arrival (YUM). Would definitely recommend to clients James - World Travel Warehouse

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable. Location just OK.”
Reviews.Author: Kath_Travelling
Reviews.Content: If you are staying a short time in Venice and want to be near the train station for easy in/out this is the place. It is very clean and accommodating. The breakfast buffet is excellent! The restaurant looks right over the canal. The rooms are small but very clean and well appointed. Ours had a great view of the canal which was lovely. The only downside is the location. If you want to be close to the sights this hotel is a bit of a trek by foot. The water taxi stop is right down the street but it is pricey and takes a long time to go around the canal to get to the main tourist area. By foot, it is a very long and confusing walk. This is plus if you really want to see Venice but if you just want to be in the heart of the tourism action stay somewhere closer to the Square. The hotel was ideal for us as we flew into Venice airport and the bus stop is a very short walk over a bridge to the hotel. We did not have to spend the $80 dollars for a water taxi from the airport. We only stayed one night and took the train out to Florence so it was great to be one block from the train station with all our bags. The hotel's location really saved us quite a bit of money as Venice is very expensive for public transport, especially from the airport. The rate for the hotel and what you get was also excellent compared to others. So, if you do not mind walking or taking the water taxi around (there is a pass you can buy that is good for 24 hours for $16) and want a very nice hotel outside the tourist area this is the one. It is also incredibly easy to find - something we could not say for the other hotels in the Square. As we walked around the streets we saw other options we considered and were very glad we chose Hotel Principe because it was so easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pennsylvania1
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights at the beginning of March. I booked a Superior canal-view room directly on-line for 190 Euros/night. Our room, on the first floor, was very large and had two small walk-out balconies facing the Grand Canal. Despite facing the canal, it was much quieter than our previous stays at their sister-hotel Amadeus down the street where our room faced the street. The breafast selections were OK but there was no fresh fruit. The hotel is about 500 feet west of the S. Lucia train station and also importantly, if there are flood condiitons in Venice, the street is either above the 120 cm flood level or has the raised walkways. The 1, 2, and 41/42 Vaparetto stops are right in front of the Station. There was a small grocery store right down the sreet and a larger Billa strore about 1/2 mile to the east. There are numerous tourist-trap eating places on the street plus lots of small shops and gelato joints.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Principe”
Reviews.Author: ElsLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay in Hotel Gardnena but when we arrived they said they are closing for a month, with fears of being sent to a shabby hotel, I was eased & delighted when the receptionist said they are upgrading us to their 4 star hotel across the roadâ€¦ hotel principe. The hotel was beautiful & we were really blessed to be upgraded. Situated on the Grand Canal the views were beautiful. Our room was rather small unlike the others I saw in passing but I canâ€™t complain. After all I am in Venice!! The bed was big & it had built in wardrobes which was great. The bathroom was all you need. We didnâ€™t plan to spend much time in the hotel. The breakfast room itself was beautiful & the breakfast was great. They had a great variety of foods. We didnâ€™t eat in the restaurant for dinner as we found it a bit costly. The location was perfect. So close to the station & Piazzale Roma we didnâ€™t have to treck around much. The hotel was in the Cannaregio area & out of all the areas we visited this was my favourite. It had a real authentic feel to it, it was lovely seeing the locals going around buying there bits & bobs. We found it much cheaper then some of the other areas. It was busy but not too busy. I recommend coming out your hotel, turning right over the bridge & getting lost! There are some great areas around there. Thereâ€™s also a great Pizza restaurant across the hotel called Ae Ouchâ€¦ lovely big pizzas for a reasonable price. Overall we love the hotel but of course we paid a quarter of what we should have due to the upgrade so we were blessed. Enjoy Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: ScenicRoute74
Reviews.Content: Travelled by train so this hotel proved very close and walkable from Venice Station, right on main canal. Reception area felt luxurious but we had to ask to be transferred (at an increased cost) to a larger room as there was no room for luggage or to walk round bed. Rooms were shabby sheek, in total contrast to reception area. Peeling floral wallpaper, very old bathrooms etc. Staff were not helpful and we didn't eat in hotel, using some of the restaurants nearby. A word of warning to anyone staying here - we were offered the use of a hotel water taxi to take us to the island of Murano, not realising this was an 'arrangement' between hotel and venetian glass people so when you arrived at the jetty you were 'captured' by a welcoming salesman who took you on a personal conducted tour, ending up in their Private Collection. Trying to withstand the pressure to buy very expensive items resulted in the purchase of something quite small but unless you take a photograph of what you have ordered you will have no comeback on receiving something diffierent. Friends who were put in a similar position taking a water taxi from their hotel were shown the back door at Murano to make their own way home once they made it clear they would not purchase . BEWARE AND BE CAREFUL - at the point of purchase they say they cannot use your Mastercard (which would give you protection) and want cash or switch. Best idea is to take the offer of boat 2/3/4 day tickets and make your own way round all the attractions as the waterboats are frequent and go everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: J_on_tour1
Reviews.Content: The decor in the foyer was very good with a welcome to match. The room we were given overlooked the side courtyard where the market stalls were trading which was not a problem but gave us some interesting views at times. The room had everything that we needed and the size was fine for the duration of the stay we booked for. Some of the old fashioned period decoration in this room would need some loving restoration and may not be to everyones satisfaction. The TV was integrated with a computer & would be ideal for business use although there was no time to use it. Breakfast is served in a great room that looks out onto the grand canal and although we could not get a seat near the window on the first morning as it was a sunday, the following morning was fine as all the weekend travellers had gone home. It was interesting to watch the market trader, binman and ambulance go past the window by means of boat! Breakfast was plentiful and nothing to complain about although i'm not sure how the coffee machines would stand up to the huge crowds in the summer. It seemed a full time job for one staff member on the first morning. We managed to get a good meal nearby just up the street opposite the bridge. This was also the stop for the waterbus for which we had a travelticket for the time we were there. It was good to stay at this location as the centre of venice would possibly have been more difficult to access with suitcases and the boat trip in each day was spectacular anyway. We were asked on departure whether we wanted to leave our cases which was a nice touch because usually i find its the other way around. We took them up on this offer as we had a late flight back and this was only a short stay. I would not hesitate to look this place up again when i return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Principe”
Reviews.Author: popskid2
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful Hotel located directly on the Grand Canal about a half block from the train station and the Ponte dei Scalzi (bridge). The service there is great and the rooms are spotlessly clean. We were booked into a standard room but I asked for a special room as this was a very special trip for my family. They gave us a fantastic room on the top floor with a huge terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. It made our trip to Venice even more unforgetable because we were able to watch the sun rise and set over Venice and we also watched the traffic on the Grand Canal at all hours of the day and night. It could not have been any better. This was by far the nicest "4 Star" hotel we stayed in during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: Jameses_123
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, easy to find and is certainly a lot quieter than other areas of Venice. First impressions of the hotel were good. Competent reception staff and nice lobby area. The room (217) was very disappointing considering the rating of the hotel and the price we paid - it was hideously overpriced for what it is. Based on the room we stayed in, the hotel is certainly not 4 *. To be honest it is an low-mid 3* hotel, but then it is in Venice where everything costs more than it should. Room 217 is dated and in need of a complete makeover, e.g. dirty handmarks on the headboards(!), chipped furniture, uncomfortable beds, curtains and voiles with holes in them and the A/C didn't work. Also there were only 2 power sockets in the room which were very conveniently placed behing the fridge and TV so we to try and move furniture to be able to use the sockets. The bathroom was a reasonable size with a large shower which leaked all over the bathroom floor and the hairdryer was a complete joke. The room also had a certain aroma to it which I can't quite describe.... In my opinion (based on the crap room), the hotel is OK if you plan to spend as much time as you can out exploring the city and surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: maleah18
Reviews.Content: When the Bellini was experiencing various malfuntions, we were sent to the Principe. Given our inconvience from the Bellini, we were upgraded with a room overlooking the canal and breakfast (sadly we had to leave before trying)! The view was gorgeous. The room was pleasant and clean. The bathroom was unexpected for what I'm used to with European hotels. It was big and lite up with italian tile. Principe's staff was top notch. We received a great welcome and plenty of information to our transportation questions. To start of things, we took up the complementary taxi ride to Murano!! Wow. It was great even though we had to take part in one of the hotels business partner's glass blowing demonstrations. After the demonstration, we were lead to the sales area. Kind of felt like I'd entered a timeshare demonstration. But the salesmen weren't TOO pushy and we managed to escape to do what we intended....stroll around. Everything was great, BUT, the horrible sewer smell that seemed to randomly occur from time to time. I couldn't really blame the hotel entirely, as the smell lingered in most parts of Venice that I visited. But I awoke at 1:00 am to the smell, and found it hard to fall back to sleep. Given this is probably one of the better hotels in Venice for the price, I'd stay here again, but next time I'll bring a nose plug.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to train station, terrible AC”
Reviews.Author: PaulieGA
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful days and two nights in Venice. The Principe was OK. The good: the breakfast was abundant and quite good, the staff helpful and honest (tracked me down at breakfast after I left an unsigned traveler's check at the front desk). The bathroom was good and the shower better than most we've found in Europe. The hotel is also a very short walk from both the train station and one of the main boat stops.The bad: if you're an American you will hate the lame air conditioning. Even by normal European standards this AC is really lousy. Maybe it was just our room, but somehow I doubt it. We had big problems sleeping at night due to it. If we return to Venice we will probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “If in Venice again, we will return”
Reviews.Author: naplesmom
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms adjoining since we were traveling with our two daughters, when we arrived, they had only one room reserved for us, we had our confirmation email and showed it to them, they found another room on the same floor, but it was not adjoining and our daughters were down the hall from us. We really liked the location, (arriving by train, there are no stairs or bridges to carry luggage over) we loved the quaintness of the rooms although the showers were small. We did not have canal view rooms, but we were on an upper floor and the roof tops were pretty. We thought internet was included or free in the lobby, but there were charges for internet service, the breakfast was excellent and we were seated at a table with a grand canal view on our second morning. We bought 12 hour passes on the ferry and visited Lido, San Marco, Rialto twice and walked from Rialto to the hotel also, we loved getting off the main streets and on and off the ferry where we wanted. Venice has a lot of foot traffic in the summer! I am so glad we were not in the San Marco area, the crowds were terrible. The area between the train station and the hotel has little shops and restaurants, walking past the hotel has more shopping and restaurants. We walked a lot, and never felt unsafe even at midnight.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms”
Reviews.Author: rubberbandeffect
Reviews.Content: The location of the Principe made it easy to get to. We took the bus from the airport and then it was a short walk to the hotel. Though I wouldn't have attempted the walk with too much heavy luggage as there were several bridges to cross. However, it seems that Venice is in the process of creating ramps on all the bridges so that you don't need to pick up your luggage, but can wheel it over the bridges. The hotel has easy access to a Vaporetto stop and it is a nice ride up to St Marks, but a long long walk - especially as you rarely get there without getting somewhat lost on the way. The breakfast was the best we had on our group tour and the dinner was fine if not inspired. We requested a triple for myself and two kids and were given a large two room suite with a fine sized bathroom. The room had several murano glass chandaliers which made the room even prettier. The room and bathroom were clean. The staff was exceptionally nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: vineetjain1973
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and very good location. Just a few walking steps from the St. Lucia Station. They have canal facing rooms which are much better than the other side rooms. We stayed one night in the ordinary rooms and they are definitely not worth the money (just like a 1-2 star room. But yes, the canal facing rooms have a better interior, lighting, bathroom, and definitely a beautiful view of the canal. It seems like a room in a 3-4 star hotel. The reception staff is good and the breakfast is good (though not very classy and elaborate). There is a restaurant right opposite the hotel that is very nice and reasonable and has good food esp Pizzas. It has a huge menu! Tim mobile a mobile shop is about 5 minutes walking if you want a SIM card. A convenience store about 7-8 shops before the TIM Mobile is very reasonable for stocking all you water/drinks and food stuff. Overall an excellent location and best hotel in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tdboldt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were honeymooning in Italy and Austria for 15 days. Hotel Principe was one of the two best hotels we stayed at (and one of the cheapest). (Our price point for hotels was between ($140 and $220 per night) Knowing that we were on our honeymoon, they gave us one of the few rooms with a priceless view of the grand canal. Staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke English well. The breakfast that was included with the hotel room included numerous types of fresh bakery products; about 5 types of juice, fresh fruit, and any type of coffee you wanted, self serve (the coffee was bad). (In our experience, breakfasts in Italy are typically simple and bland. If youâ€™re looking for an exquisite breakfast experience, visit Austria). Our room (#126) which was on the 2nd floor (Called the first floor by Europeans), was just perfect; two huge (floor to ceiling windows) that opened up to the Canal; my wife and I sat on a couple arm chairs for a good hour or so just watching the boats pass by. The walls were covered in very elaborate wall paper and there was a chandelier in the middle of the room. The bathroom had a full tub, and the shower head was located at the end of the tub (not in the middle of the tub as we experienced at a couple other hotels) and the location of the hotel Principe is perfect-just a short 5 minute walk from the train station (it's a bit more of a haul if your coming from the bus stop...in that case, just take the #25 or #5 vaporetta one stop to the train terminal, or climb over a few bridges. Even without the room that we had, I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: abench
Reviews.Content: We loved our room here. Not huge, but plenty of room for my husband and I. Very updated and modern. Our room had a bathtub and shower. Out our windows we could view the Grand Canal, very romantic. Very close to the train station - great for arriving and finding hotel quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but staff and food let it down”
Reviews.Author: pattres
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked this trip as an anniversary present. The hotel itself was very nice and our room overlooked the grande canal. The room was beautiful and very clean , there was a huge basket of fruit and a bottle of wine on the bedside table, but there were 2 things that let it down for me. The reception staff I found to be quite curt and not very friendly at all . The breakfast was the worst breakfast I have ever eaten in a hotel anywhere. We waited at the entrance to restaurant to be told where to sit and the staff just walked passed us and we had to go and ask what we had to do could we just sit anywhere or did we have to sit at the same table every morning ?? The breakfast was very basic certainly not 4 star standard and its the only hotel I have been to that you have to get your own coffee from a machine !!! The food was not good at all. We didnt eat at the restaurant in the evening the morning was bad enough. There are lots of restaurants just outside the hotel. If you go to St Marks square get there early - we were there before 9am, and there was only a short que to go into the Basilica, but make sure you take a jacket, cardi or stoll as you have to have your arms covered and longer trousers.

Reviews.Title: “Really Liked the Grand Hotel Principe”
Reviews.Author: gir7375
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for two nights on our Italy trip. The hotel is very close to the Railroad station which was good for us since we were traveling by rail to various cities in Italy. Nice historic building with new bathrooms ( yes, the shower is tiny) but tasteful and clean. The hotel is filled with beautiful Murano glass chandeliers. The Reception was fine and breakfast was really good. We had a nice view of the Grand Canal and while the hotel is quite far from St Mark's, we really liked the area. It was far less crowded and there were a lot of nice restaurants nearby that were less touristy, a nice break especially when it the weather is hot. I would recommend this hotel, if you are traveling by rail and you like to explore a little. A really nice area to walk around and the vaperetto stop was really close to get to all the key locations.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, small, not four star”
Reviews.Author: beslondon
Reviews.Content: Location far away from tourist attractions. Very small rooms, shower was so small that if you turned around you would turn the tap off or change temperature (we are not big people either). The reception advised us of a free tour of a glass factory on Murano, trip there was lovely, had a 10 minute demo, asked for tips, then pushed through the to shop which was sorely overpriced. We didn't buy much and so we were treated like lepers, pushed out the back door to an alleyway and had to find our own transport back to Venice. Not impressed. Breakfast was lacking, the bread rolls looked like and tasted like they were left overs from the previous night dinner, choice wasn't great either. It was ok considering what we paid, but would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JMCAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Principe for three nights as part of a Monograms tour. Overall, it was really great - very clean, large room, very helpful and friendly staff and in a great location. Yes, its a 20-30 minute walk to St. Marks square, but its very convenient to the train station, a 30 second walk to the nearest water bus stop (get the multi-day water bus tourist pass), and the area all around it is filled with interesting stores, lots of cafes and restaurants, a vegetable market around the corner, and a great bakery within 50 yards. Also, since the prices of almost everything increase as you get closer to St. Marks square, things are a little more reasonable here in terms of prices (though nothing in Italy is reasonable right now due to the weakness of the dollar). Another useful point - about a 5 minute walk to the right you will come to a supermarket on the left hand side - a great place to stock up on beverages and bread and avoid the expensive restaurants. In addition, they have great gelato, though there is a lot of that around! So, a great hotel in a very good location...

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: asample
Reviews.Content: Hotel Principe was wonderful! I'm very picky when it comes to cleanliness and feeling safe and I just loved this hotel. It was SO charming and right there on the Grand Canal; and very easy to get to off the bus from the airport (no need to pay for the very expensive water taxi). Simply walk towards the canal off the bus and you'll see the hotel on the left side of the canal. I believe we only had to walk over 1 small bridge and one larger bridge about the distance of 4-5 blocks (maybe less). I also thought it was a great price, but we went in November which probably helped. We did not book a room with a canal view, but somehow we got one and it was amazing. Out of all of the hotels we stayed in throughout Italy, this one had the largest bathroom and best breakfast. The room furnishings were very old, but they were Venetian. There were great places to eat and shop right out the entrance to the hotel. We also took advantage of the free boat ride to Murano Island - and we didn't even have to ask, they just offered it to us. The breakfast was amazing and served in this grand ballroom and if it's warmer out, you can eat waterside on the veranda. I highly recommend this hotel and if I ever go back to Venice, I plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good taste of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Jillibus
Reviews.Content: We were booked as part of a tour group, and were pleasantly surprised to find an elegant, well-appointed grand-style hotel in a great location on the Grand Canal. Our room windows opened onto an air shaft, which was landscaped as a courtyard and quite charming. Only drawback was the noise from other rooms, lack of security (being on floor level of courtyard) and no canal view. However, the Murano glass chandelier and sconces and fine sheets, plus an excellent bathroom, were a delight. I'd stay again, and choose a higher floor and GC view, if I could afford it! Oh, by the way... we had breakfasts at the hotel as part of our tour, and the marmalade croissants, still warm from the oven, were the stuff of dreams!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelready418
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week Italian tour. Hotel was conveniently located on the Grand Canal. It was cold so we couldn't eat outdoors to our disappointment, but the view was great. The room was a bit small, but clean. No bathtub, but a decent shower. I found the staff I dealt with to be responsive to requests; such as for softer pillows. Food was okay, but since we were with a tour and didn't order from menu can not comment on other dishes. They served a lovely breakfast buffet every day. My only complaint was our room was located on the street side of the hotel and since we left the windows open it was quite noisy. I had my ear plugs from the plane and used them every night. Since the train station is close, people pulled their luggage across the cobblestone street at all hours and this produced the noises. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic City break”
Reviews.Author: KIRANW
Reviews.Content: My husband, my two year old son and myself stayed at the Principe for a long weekend in March 2008. We had a fantatstic stay, the hotel staff are lovely and polite. There were not many children staying at the hotel but the staff gave my son loads of attention and provided us with milk for him free of charge. We arrived at the hotel from the airport via a private speed boat transfer, which was well worth the Â£80 Euros we paid. The boat was able to drop us off dirtectly in front of the hotel which was fantatsic!! The hotel buffet breakfast were great too. I would stay at the hotel again, but would ask for a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Principe”
Reviews.Author: mrsgeorgie
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at the Principe ...nice, clean.. our room was a bit on the small side..internet connection available in room..overall.. comfortable. Friends stayed in other rooms at the Principe which were a bit bigger. Staff was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Location~ about 35 minutes (without getting lost) from St Marks square (walking). But what a great walk! Go to Hosteria Al Vecio Bragosso for dinner..great food, amazing service (ask for Alessandro Coppi)...let him order for you..and prepare yourself for a great evening of dinner, dessert, and drink. I didn't think it was a four star hotel..until I visited some friends at their hotel (which was a 3 star)..and realized how 4 star this hotel really was. I would stay here again..however, I would make special room request (view, and size) ahead of time...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: souterCroydon
Reviews.Content: Booked through Easyjet for a 4 day break, and i must say very pleasantly surprised. Absolutely fabulous location and upon walking all over Venice i would definitely say one of the best areas.When we arrived the sun was out and we had a glass on wine on the hotel terrace overlooking the Grand Canal, I thought I was in heaven!!!. The staff were the friendliest I had ever met and the reception staff knew our room numbers from the very 1st day. Breakfast was great for Europe, with one of the best scrambled eggs I have ever had.I did ask if we could have a room with a view but was told this was an extra 60 Euros extra per night but they would give me a room in a good location which ended up being on the corner of the hotel with a side Canal view at no extra charge.Certainly worth asking!. Everyone kept telling me Venice was smelly but I can honestly say that in March i only smelt something once and that was on Burano Island. Burano Island is like Balymory with all the quaint little houses in bright colours, this island is known for lace and certainly worth a visit but in contrast Murano Island which is known for glass is like a drab ghost town and time better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Had a brilliant break!!”
Reviews.Author: coolplaceWales_UK
Reviews.Content: Booked through Easyjet - Â£320 for 2 for 2 nights B&B with flights from E.Midlands - Marco Polo - the only downside was the squeezyjet flight! Loved the hotel - we paid the 60â‚¬ per room per night extra for the canal view which included a small balcony (standing room) and was well worth it. Lovely clean room, lovely 4 piece bathroom with shower (no bath), slippers & cosy towels. We had internet access too - WiFi in the reception area too. Breakfast was great but it was very quiet when we were there so can imagine the queue's for the coffee machine - we must be spoilt in the UK with pots of tea/coffee on the tables! Didn't eat there for dinner as we were spoilt for choice with so much on the doorstep. Re the glass trips - we just smiled and said ok we'll see when they mentioned the trips - been warned on here obviously but we did go to Murano ourselves for a nosey - the Vaporetto tickets cover the islands/Lido too so we just used that and had lunch on Burano - much nicer than Murano - small quaint houses painted brightly but still with the canals etc. San Marco - whilst going round the Basilica itself we thought we'd nip into the "prayers only" chapel for a quiet moment - didn't realise we were walking into full Mass - sat through it out of respect and guilt but it was looking back probably the highlight of the tour as it was our wedding anniversary and as we didn't get married in church I could imagine my sweet old Granny rubbing her hands in glee thinking she'd got us in there for at least an anniversary! But its not like the UK where you can go in and say a few quiet prayers as you're disturbing the Mass - they should point this out really. We loved Hotel Principe and would go back for definate!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brover
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from staying at the Principe Hotel in Venice. It is situated directly on the Grand Canal near the train and Bus station. If you enjoy walking this is an ideal location as you can walk through all the shops to St Marks Square in about 40 minutes. On the way you will pass the Rialto bridge and generally see all the sights. The large water taxis are ideal for travelling the waterways and there is a stop practically outside the hotel. The Hotel was first rate and although the room was small it was clean and the bathroom had fresh linen every day. The breakfast menu had plenty of choice and you could eat as much or little as you liked whilst looking out over the Grand Canal. Staff were very friendly and organised a free water taxi to Murano to the glassworks, you do have to catch your own taxi back but this was very simple. As a tip the further away from St Marks Square you go the cheaper the glass becomes. We also took in a show about the carnival which was well worth seeing, leaflets are handed out near the shops for this. This appeared to be a good time to vist Venice as it was busy but not overcrowded.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms, over priced”
Reviews.Author: fullers17
Reviews.Content: Positive things about the hotel was it was close to the train station and on the grand canal. The initial service on arrival was good. They showed us a cheap local restaurant and offered a free boat trip to Murano to see a glass factory (which tried really hard into pressuring us to buy something). When we asked about the internet access in our room, they told us not to bother and use the internet cafe next door. Breakfast was average. The eggs and bacon were disgusting. However, the continental side of breakfast was good. Our room was in the back corner of the hotel and was small and pokey. We didn't have a bath and our room was tired and worn down. We felt like we had been put in the room with all the chipped, cracked and falling apart furniture. The hotel was also noisy. You could hear people across the hall in their room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hixaire
Reviews.Content: Be careful: It is not a 4 Star Hotel at all. My room (211) was tiny, without bathtub! They charge 6 euros for room service! Breakfast is ok. Staff is average for Venice. Don't expect too much. I won't go back to this hotel. Except that, I love Venice ;)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: ABC25
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last stop on our trip through Italy. We had stayed in lovely hotels until we reached Venice. The Principe was by far the most disgusting hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel staff was unhelpful and rude, the rooms were rundown (scratches all over the walls, carpets were all worn down, bathroom floors all cracked, moldy tubs, I could go on), and the hotel itself was much of the same once you got past the lobby. For what we were paying it was a crime to have to stay in those conditions. I would never return and I would never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A taste of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: freefly1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Principe Hotel (Sept '07). The hotel is within easy walking distance from the main bus stop. The hotel is very nice and the staff were pleasant. The hotel is fairly far away from St. Marks square however walking all over Venice is the way to go. The included buffet was decent and the in room internet was very nice to have. We had a room on the street side of the hotel. The room was stylish and comfortable with a very clean bathroom (lots of marble). Venice was one of our favorite spots during our three week stay in Europe and the Principe Hotel added to our stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced drinks”
Reviews.Author: GemmaDavies
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Coffee, and excellent breakfast, but disappointed in other aspects. Our room was on the small side and certainly overpriced, overlooking the street with just a glimpse of the Grand Canal between other buildings, although the bathroom was up-to-date, notwithstanding half -sized bath. Wasn't wealthy enough to use the bar facilities with local beer at over 4 euros per small bottle and we were therefore fearful of trying the restaurant for dinner, as it would appear that Venice restaurants mostly add a cover charge for at least 1euro 50 and slap on a further 12 1/2% for service, this percentage is added on after the cover charge which ups the bill even more!! Taxi to the airport 90 Euros, (one way) only a few kilometers away. Front desk often indifferent and mostly without a smile, so what's new in reception habits!!!! The city is unique and charming, but unless you are going for a 'culture fix' ,3 days is long enough

Reviews.Title: “Loved the coffee”
Reviews.Author: Odojoe
Reviews.Content: Our room was facing an inside court so not much to see there. The room seemed quite old and not up to category. The bath though was a pleasure. We bought vaporetto passes good for 36 hours and used them often. I was disappointed the hotel did not provide better maps. The one they did provide was a xerox copy and very small. With the intricacies of getting around there, it was almost worthless. i was extremely disappointed with the bread in Italy, it was all very hard. The exception was the Principe where the rolls were great. They also had an espresso machine which provided me the best coffee in Italy. The front desk people were always quick to get us our key even if they were in the middle of a conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Pay For, Customers Treated Badly”
Reviews.Author: TheCenturyCompany
Reviews.Content: First, some positive things. The hotel is very close to the train station, this saves a lot of hassle with luggage if you arrive by train. The back of the hotel does face the grand canal (the hotel faces it, but NOT all of the rooms, see more on this). There is a vaporetto stop fairly close by. The hotel has a nice lobby and a variety of rooms, our AC worked OK. There is a nice restaurant on the first floor. The free morning breakfast is good. A bar next door serves drinks and has a piano bar (more on this). The rooms are fine, decent bathrooms and overall was clean, but......the real scene at this hotel is during our stay was the terrible way people were treated by the front desk staff. They did not assign us to the room category we paid for, then tried repeatedly to get us to accept even lesser rooms. When we asked for what we paid for (100 euros extra per night for the canal view other reviewers raved about). the staff argued, misled us about room views (saying rooms with terraces had no view at all - untrue - only ours didn't) and made us go back and forth to different rooms, each worse then the other. It was a completely unecessary hostile game that seemed to be going on with many guests staying that weekend. Each time we pased by someone at the front desk was chewing out a guest. The theme appeared to be the same - people not getting the room categories they had paid for, then getting verbally roughed up by the staff. Once we accepted (at some point you just give up) and got settled into a different category room that was not what we paid for, we asked for the rate to also be changed and they said no, they still charged for the highest priced room category, there was no geting anywhere with them. While you try not to let staff ruin your stay, it did affect us and we heard from other guests who experienced the same so we knew it wasn't just us. All that aside, a few other letdowns. We wanted to experience the fun piano bar we read about but never hapened, the bartender was hardly ever there and no one ever showed to play. We were told we could have breakfast on the patio by the canal but at breakfast when we asked they said we were not allowed at the tables outside, only inside in the dining room. When we did venture out, we found ourselves mostly in the Rialto/St Marks area, which required daily vaporetto rides, so if I went back I would probably choose a hotel closer to this area than the train station. Would rather lug the luggage once then have to deal with the vaporettos 3-4 times a day. If you really want to go to this hotel, I would suggest booking the best rate available and not getting caught up in the battle and price for a "canal view" room, just take whatever they give you and don't argue. If you must, the prize rooms are 123 and 122, and they know this and probably won't give them to you, but go ahead and ask, you never know. It is a shame, this is an OK property, but have never seen people treated this badly, no excuse, will try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: nanhey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from the 16-18th Of July 2007. We booked this hotel after reading the lot of reviews.... Since our train to nice was late in the night we had to choice but to take a hotel next to the railway station.... The hotel was nothing what i'd expected it to be.... The rooms were the size of a pegionhole... with NO ventilation.....the view from the room was Marvelous... ;) (Just kidding..... look at the pictures & you'll know what i am talking about).... The front office staff was REALLY rude.... maybe cause was were indians & could't speak a word of italian.... they really need to get their staff trained... For the price we paid (180 Euros) we could have got a 5 star delux property in india.... One last suggestion (which everyone suggested & i unfortunatly didn't listen)... PLEASE DON'T BOTHER TAKING THE FREE BOAT RIDE TO THE BURANNO GLASS FACTORY! TS GONNA MAKE HOLES IN YOUR POCKET & COST YOU MUCH MORE THAN THE FREE 20 EURO BOAT RIDE...... If you need to go please take the public transport to buranno island! All in all a very average hotel... please reseach a bit more before you book your hotel....

Reviews.Title: “A good pick”
Reviews.Author: Summer62
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Principe last week, and overall , it was a very good experience: clean, modern (quiet) accomodations; great location; generally helpful staff, and a very good American (hot) breakfast. One of the rooms occupied by our party had a private terrace with a partial canal view, which was a lovely touch. And free in-room internet access is a bonus. My only complaint is that my room was too warm, but had I the presence of mind to notify the staff, they would would have tweaked the controls from a central location. I would definitely recommend the Principe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: quatl002
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel just a few minutes walk on land from the train station is a plus. A room overlooking the Grande Canal, if you are prepared to pay the extra charge, is a definite must, especially if you can get a balcony. Full size balconies are few and far between, and there are a couple of Romeo and Juliet balconies. If you can score a full size balcony overlooking the Grande Canal (we had one in Room 122) that's the best scenario. But the hotel falls short with the rooms being tired, carpet threadbare, and the like. Strangely, however, the bathroom was completely updated and while indeed wonderful, made the room feel that much more out of sync. The breakfast room was fine as was the food. Vaporetto (water bus) stations nearby at the railway station are a good thing. But the location of the hotel near the train station means that you must be prepared for a long walk or a lengthy water bus ride to all major attractions save and except for the neighbouring Ghetto which is a must-see. Was able to book dinner at Restaurant Vini da Gigio on the restaurant's web site before leaving for Italy, and highly recommend this wonderful restaurant which is in the Ghetto area. Hotel Principe is satisfactory for one or two nights, but not more. If your goal is to be close to the railway station because you have to catch a train in a day or two, or if you have lots of luggage and do not want to travel all through Venice to reach your hotel, or if you have disability issues, or if you are concerned about poor weather or late night arrivals, then this is the hotel for you because you walk on land (no water involved at all) to get between the railway station and the hotel. If you do not want to take the vaporetto, the hotel has a private docking facility from which you can order a water taxi, albeit at a much higher expense than the vaporetto. Bottom line is, if you wish to be close to the railway station and not have to travel far with your luggage, then this is the hotel for you, but if you are prepared to travel further afoot, there are better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: criddymonkey
Reviews.Content: Last summer my husband and I spent 2 days here. The location was fantastic. The hotel is right on the Grand Canal, and close to the train station. There are lots of restaurants and shops nearby. Our room had two little balconies with great views of the canal and the busy pedestrian street out front. Our room had two separate twin beds, but they were easy to push together so that wasn't a big deal. The room was smaller than we expected, but it was nice. The hotel bar is cute, with live entertainment. The next time we go to Venice we will stay here again. Venice is such a fabulous, romantic city. You will definitely love it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place!!!”
Reviews.Author: spambrighton
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed at the Principe last year booking through Lastminite.com. It was our first holiday together and the most amazing. The hotel is beutiful and the staff friendly. The position is pertect as the area has some lovely resturants and is a short walk to the Rialto bridge and st marks sqaure.We have had some amazing holidays since and so decided to write some reviews. We will definately be going back and advise any couple to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in love with Venice the moment we walked into this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JV_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Principe, June 2007. We had a triple room which was bright, spacious, luxurios and delightful. The breakfast is both hot and cold with food of all descriptions. Located on the Grand Canal only a 10 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. Dinner in the evening is excellent. The staff are all helpful and curteous.The concierge arranged all our tour excursions including the Murano glass factory on the islands leaving from the hotel's own grand canal jetty. The Piano Bar for Cocktails was a regular meeting place with a wonderful view of the Grand Canal. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCMichigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Principe Hotel in Venice in May 2007 for 2 days. We loved it! The location was great: close to the train station, one of only 3 footbridges that goes over the Grand Canal and a vaporetto spot. The room was good size with a very spacious bathroom. There was a small balcony with a sideways view of the Grand Canal. The king size bed was two twins together, but we didn't have any problem with it. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had no problem with noise. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Greg_Annie
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay at the Grand Principe Hotel (at the start of a 12 day tour of Italy thru Gate1travel) was wonderful in every respect. The staff greeted us immediately upon our arrival by water taxi from the airport. They took our luggage to the room in minutes, and were as friendly as they were prompt. Our dinner at the hotel was lovely, as the dining room overlooks the Grand Canal. The breakfast buffet each morning was a veritable banquet, with a variety of meats, eggs, cheeses, cereals, fruits, juices, rolls, and coffees. Service was excellent, and the atmosphere was charming. The hotel's location was ideal, close to the train station, within a lively but not hectic district of Venice, nearby beautiful churches and bridges, and overlooking the Grand Canal with its nightly gondola traffic. The rooms seemed to be medium-sized relative to most hotels in Italy, and everything was very clean. The bathrooms had obviously been completely modernized, and were among the best-equipped and appointed we saw in our 12 day tour of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location , good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: grandtourer
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff efficient, room was quiet although extremely basic and requiring refurbishing.Carpet on edge of stairs was torn, could be a danger. Location is the selling point, on Grand Canal, good views. Breakfast was very good with plenty of variety.The area outside a little tacky with souvenir stalls etc. Venice when the shops are closed must be the graffiti capital of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Wedding Receptions”
Reviews.Author: Tinker919
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception at this hotel on 27th April 2007 and it was just perfect! The location is great and the hotel's private function room is beautiful with lovely views. The staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough for us, the didn't stop all night and were very helpful. We had a party of 30 people and nothing was too much for them. The food is amazing and the hotel certainly made our memorable wedding even more memorable and not one of us can fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlegib
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this Hotel and found it to be excellent. The breakfast was lovely, plenty of choice. The evening meal we had there was a little expensive but again was very good.The rooms were spotless and cleaned every day, also the bedlinen and towels were changed every day. The Hotel is well placed for getting around, with the waterbus stop just a few minutes walk from the hotel, near to the railway station. Also the 72 hour bus ticket at 30euros is very good value, you can hop on and off as many times as you like, so saving quite a bit, because a single trip is 6euros a time. A very good city break, one of the best yet. Will be going back and to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: sarahc8208
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Principe definitely had its up and downs. To start, we were supposed to stay at the Amadeus, one of the Principe's sister hotels that is right down the street and of comparable quality, but when we arrived at the Amadeus there were problems with our reservation. We had to cancel one of our nights of our stay ahead of time and instead of removing the single night, they cancelled the entire reservation. This was disappointing because my husband really had his heart set on the Amadeus. We were told to check into the Principe since the Amadeus had no more rooms and when we got to the new hotel, they tried to charge us for the night that was originally cancelled. It was a huge mess, but luckily my husband had copies of all email correspondence with him. So if you make any changes to your reservation, bring copies of any email confirmations you have since their computer system seems to be quite a mess. The men at the front desk were very rude and arrogant about this matter and were not happy to admit they were wrong. So here's the room rundown: +Very Clean Room -Hard Beds -Horrible Shower System (makes a huge mess and is very tiny) +Nice Restaurant with Delicious Food +Short Walk from Train Station +Great Bartender in the Piano Bar -No Piano Playing in the Piano Bar during our entire stay (very disappointing) -Beds were two twins pushed together -- Not Very Romantic -Thin Walls -Rude Reception Staff -Hot, Stuffy Room (not able to change temperature controls)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and great location”
Reviews.Author: Travellers-r-us
Reviews.Content: We took our 2 children (aged 10 and 12) to Venice for a 3 night break and decided to upgrade to a canal view after reading other reviews about small rooms and cramped bathrooms. We had 2 bedrooms so it was a lot extra to pay but we really feel it was worth it. Both bedrooms had balconies overlooking the grand canal and the Scalzi bridge so you could watch the gondolas and water traffic passing by. We also arrived for the last night of the carnival and watched the firework display at St Marc's Sq from our bedroom balcony which was lovely. The bathrooms were beautiful and I was very impressed with the maid service. I have never had rooms cleaned so perfectly and when we went out of an evening the bathrooms were cleaned again with fresh towels (twice a day) and the beds were turned down every evening which was a nice touch as well. We all enjoyed the breakfast and some mornings when it got quite busy and they did run out of things you didn't have to wait very long for it to be replenished. We also had an evening meal which was excellent and very reasonably priced. We paid twice as much to eat pasta and chicken at a small trattoria near St Marc's Square. We really liked the location. The hotel is still in a very busy street and lively area but away from the main tourist spots. It meant a lot of walking but I think wherever you stay in Venice you will end up walking a lot . You can also use the water buses when you get tired and there is a stop very near the hotel. We all enjoyed our stay in Venice and would like to go back again and would stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Pricipe Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShrewsburyManUtdFan
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and 2 daughters to Venice on 31 December 2006 for a 5 night stay at the Principe Hotel on B&B basis. I booked 2 rooms, one for my wife and I, the other for the children. I have mixed feelings about the Principe Hotel. The positives: Superb location with regards to getting in and out of Venice by rail or by airport bus. The railway station is 200m from the hotel and the Piazzale Roma (where the buses leave from to go to Treviso and Marco Polo airports) is a 10 minute walk away. Very clean hotel. Ground floor pleasantly decorated in typical venetian style. Dining room is lovely with a view accross the Grand Canal. In the warmer weather one would be able to eat out on the veranda which would be lovely place to sit and while away the time. There was plenty of choice at breakfast and the food was of excellent quality. The staff were impeccably dressed. The Negatives: If you want to vist the popular tourist areas, i.e Rialto and St Mark's Square then you will need to go by waterbus, otherwise you will have a good 45 minute/1 hour walk to do respectively, which is OK the first time you do it. A couple of points about transport: not once did we have our ticket checked on the waterbuses, which I found quite astonishing. This also was the case when we visited Venice 3 years ago. The dishonest could quite easily get around Venice for free! Be aware of the "free" private water taxi to Murano from the hotel. You get ushered into the factory for a demonstration of glass making and get pestered by a salesman from the glass factory when you arrive. Having been there and done that before on a previous trip, we managed to escape without spending our hard earned at that particular establishment. We were allocated rooms 301 and 302. The view from these rooms were appalling - see photographs. I asked at reception if we could be given alternative rooms which didn't have blank walls, drainpipes, guttering and TV aerials as the main vista. I was told that to do this we would have to up-grade our rooms at a cost of 60 Euros per night and per room! I declined this offer and had to put up with the rooms allocated. This matter is being taken up with www.superbreak.com with whom we booked. The accomodation was fairly expensive and these rooms didn't justify the price paid. The beds in the rooms were so hard that it felt as if one was sleeping on a bed of rock. The temperature control system didn't work properly in either room. The children's room was unbearably hot and ours slightly chilly. This wasn't fixed by the end of our stay. The bathrooms were the smallest I have ever seen in an hotel. I would estimate that they measured no more than 7'x5'. In that small space they crammed in a toilet, bidet, wash basin and the smallest shower enclosure that you could wish for. With regards to the latter, it was of the quadrant style being approximately 2'6" at it's widest. I am of average build and I could hardly move within the shower enclosure without knocking the shower tap on and off, or knocking it from side to side which altered the temperature from freezing cold to scalding! Goodness knows how any one of bigger bulid would manage - they would be lucky to be able to shut the door! Needless to say there wasn't a bath present, which is disgraceful for a 4 star hotel. Considering the fact that the hotel is not situated in a prime location, I found it to be poor value for money and not up to the quoted 4 star standard. I would advise anyone considering to book the hotel to ensure that they book rooms in advance which have decent views and facilities befitting a 4 star hotel. I would consider the bedrooms we had to be of 2 star standard at most. Finally, don't expect many smily faces at the hotel. The staff are generally abrupt and have an air of arrogance about them. We only met one member of staff who was cheerful and that was one of the male receptionists who was very pleasant on each occasion we saw him. I personally wouldn't want to stay at the Principe Hotel again. It was quite honestly disappointing. If you want to stay in a really lovely hotel which isn't in the touristy areas, then try the Grand Hotel Dei Dogi. We stayed there 3 years ago and it was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: lhlfl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice after spending Christmas there and staying at the Principe. We found the hotel in a perfect location, the staff were friendly and our room, although small and without a view, was spotlessly clean and quiet. We would like to thank the hotel staff for helping to make our stay so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: KAlcorn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights in a small twin room; but since we spent little time in the fifth floor room, that wasn't a problem. You can probably get better value though. Tiny shower, even for thin people. Very nice hotel bar, and in summer the Grand Canal terrace looks to be one of the best on the whole canal. Good choice of restaurants in the Canareggio neighbourhood, good shopping, and very handy for the Ferrovia/Roma vaporetto stops, and for the railway/bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Palace”
Reviews.Author: Jessylin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very pretty... a little expensive, but is VENICE!! Our room was very nice. The breakfast was good and the have the best coffee machine ever. I would come back for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Teealow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the train station and very nice inside. The rooms were adequate but getting a view of the Grand Canal will cost you an extra 60 Euros per night. The front desk was not helpful at all and never smiled. Beware of the scam they have going to Murano to see the glass blowers. They will pay for your trip out there but you have to pay for your trip back. Plus the factory tries to get you to buy extremely expensive glass items in their showroom. They are very pushy. Once you leave their factory, you can find the same items for half the price on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Such a wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: vjdantone
Reviews.Content: As part of a tour we had purchased through AAVacations.com, we were booked into the Hotel Principe in Venice. I read some of the reviews here and felt, ok...not great. Au Contraire! What a great property! As most hotels in Venice, not much to really look at from the outside, but once you stepped inside, it was definitely class. And the ROOM! (Rm 222).....a huge room, queen bed w/ a twin for my daughter, canopy bed, 12' high ceiling, a bathroom to die for, and on top of it all, two walk out french doors onto balconies overlooking the Grand Canal. WOW. For our 1st trip to Venice, what an experience. The staff here was very helpful and accomodating, the Standard breakfast the best we had during our 10 day stay in Italy. I'd definitely return to Venice and the Hotel Principe!

Reviews.Title: “Select a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jhinjhin
Reviews.Content: We were booked here thru a Travel Agent. It seems to be a big tour agency hotel. The location was convenient as it was within walking distance of the train station but that was the only plus. The hotel is in a very busy area. There are so many nicer areas just a short distance away. Or try Lido island to get away from the tourists. The hotel was dated and crowded. It did have a nice sitting area right on the canal but the waiters were rude (if you were an American). The rooms were old and run down (peeling wall paper). The windows leaked when it rained and the mattress was as hard as a rock (I actually woke up with body aches). The front desk staff will constantly try to get you to take the "free" boat to Murado island. By the way they were pressuring us I am sure they get a major kick back. Our room for three had a nice bathroom but my cousin got a room for two with a bathroom the size of a shoe box. Breakfast was good but very crowded on the weekends. Hard to get a seat. Our room over looked roof tops so none of the charm of the canal view was gained. This is not a three or four star hotel. Its more like two but at 5 star prices. Over all I would not ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Goof hotel to visit Venice”
Reviews.Author: JCDF
Reviews.Content: I was a little reluctant to book the Principe Hotel given some negative reviews on this site. However, the hotel turned out to be better than what I had expected. The location is very convenient, very close to the train station and to a vaporeto (water bus) stop. It is not close to San Marco square, but it is in a quiter area and walking to San Marco is actually very nice. The room was indeed very small and had cigarette smell. However, you are in Venice, so you want to spend as little time in the hotel as possible. Moreover, the breakfast is quite good and the price is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view made me happy.”
Reviews.Author: sharon2go
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights as part of a tour group. The room was small with 2 twin beds (as requested) and the bathroom was quite small as well. This was my first time in Europe, so I was expecting small and wasn't disappointed. I didn't really care about the size of the room, because when I opened the shutters and saw the beautiful view of the Grand Canal it didn't matter. We didn't spend much time in the room, but when we did, we were hanging out the window waving at the boats. The room was neat and clean. I really didn't require any assistance from the hotel staff, so I cannot comment except they were very pleasant. They give you these very heavy keys to your room, so every time you go out, you have to drop it at the front desk. The location, I thought was great. It was on a lively street, close to the Train Station and Rialto bridge right on the Grand Canal. There were several shops and restaurants close by. As a matter of fact, since I couldn't sleep - I was in search of a cup of coffee at 6 AM and there's a little pasteria near the train station. St. Mark's is a good 45 minute walk, but that's the way we got to see this wonderful and unique city. You can also take a valporetto which is right at the back of the hotel if you wish, so either way, you'll get to where you want to go. The only thing that drove me crazy was the coffee machine at breakfast. Instead of just pouring a pot, they had these machines you can get capuccino, latte, american, etc., but it took forever and there was always a line. (Can you tell I have to have my coffee in the morning?). Other than that, the breakfast was typical, cereal, croissants, yogurt (and I'm pretty sure there were eggs and bacon). I would stay again if I can have the same view. Some of the folks also got a little balcony - which must have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Amyfrank
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Principe is located in an excellent area on the Grand Canal. One minute from the train station with no shlepping of bags on boats! July 17 & 18 The walk to St. Marks Square was fun and different each time or we took the boat...very easy to get around Venice! The rooms are small but the baths were new and nice! The beds are hard though. In the evening we sat outside the hotel bar and watched the boats along the canal...it was lovely and romantic and not busy with tourist! The breakfast was terrible and the hotel staff is pretty aloof...but Venice is so easy on your own. I just reminded them that I saw them on trip advisor and hoped my room and experience would be better and it was.... We did have two excellent dinner meals recommend by the staff at The Gobbi across the entry way from the hotel (get the blue cheese gnocchi) and then down the street at Vittoria. The glass tour was terrible...do not waste your money...however a side trip to Burano was very nice. Do a gondola ride in the evening!

Reviews.Title: “A nice location during Summer Venice Insanity”
Reviews.Author: Apple123
Reviews.Content: Venice at the end of July is RIDICULOUS. I heard it a number of times but didn't expect to wait on 5+ hour lines to get into San Marco Basilica and FIGHT thru crowds to move anywhere in the Square. Principe's location turned out to be just what we were looking for. Very close to the train station (which makes it UBER convienent if you are travelling by train), a nice part of town with good sites and a bit of separation from the crowds. The hotel is quite large...lots of tour groups staying there...but our room was comfortable and quiet and cool. Nice restaurant/bar in the back of the hotel right on the canal...a really beatiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful lobby, okay room, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: magical127
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room at Principe Feb 3rd and 4th. It's easily located while you travel on a vaporetto as it is smack on the Grand Canal, perhaps a 2 minute walk, if that, from the Rialto Bridge and its vaporetto stop. It's classified as a 4-star on the website I booked it through, and the lobby is certainly beautiful- marble floors, oriental rugs- everything polished and immaculate. There was a nice sitting area with sofas, chairs and tables upholstered in burgundy velvet, and the front desk area was impressive. The front desk staff were not terribly impressive, but quickly checked me in and pointed me in the direction of the elevator. Nobody offered to carry my bag. Note to those who aren't fond of trekking long distances: 1) don't come to Venice as you do basically everything on foot or via boat, 2) don't book a hotel room here without making sure you can get a room close to the elevator door because by the time I got to my room (at the end of a VERY long, winding hallway, which included the occasional handful of stairs), I was literally winded (it was especially unpleasant to negotiate while intoxicated later on during the trip). I couldn't figure out how to open the room- it had a long key and what I figured out later was a magnetic block of some sort attached to it. Nobody had told me how to operate the door. I presumed one used the key- yet the key didn't open it. After fumbling for a couple of minutes an employee saw me struggling and stormed over. Confused as to why he was coming at me the way he was, as I hadn't asked him for help, I said 'hello?'. He mimicked, 'hello?' in a nasty tone of voice. At this point, after a long flight, a long walk from the airport to the Alilaguna, and with a very heavy backpack on my back- I was cranky and sure as heck didn't need his attitude problem. 'Can I help you?' I said, still unsure of what he was doing. 'Can I help you?' he parroted back nastily, took the keys out of my hand and unceremoniously smacked the magnetic block up against the side of the door on a certain area, which activated the lock and opened the door. I muttered a thank you, but he stormed off without a word. Most inappropriately handled! I entered the room. It was a single and, as I expected for European standards, was tiny. The bed was decent but not up to what I thought a 4-star would have. It contained a very small TV, small writing desk and chair, an armoire and a window with a glorious view of nothing. At least it was quiet. There was no bathtub (I expected this, though), only a shower (with lots of hot water, thank goodness). It was very clean and decorated oddly/sparcely. Pastels and neutrals were primarily used and I can't say it was a terribly attractive room, but it could have been much worse. Since I visited in the winter, the air conditioning was never used so I'm not sure how up to par it would have been should I have needed it. I tried making a call to the U.S... there was a card on my table with instructions on how to do so, and followed the directions given... and could not get through. I tried several times before calling the front desk. They say 'follow the directions on your table'. I say 'I did', and at that point they were out of ideas. I went out and ran the errands I had to run. Later on the evening I tried to call again, only I went downstairs and made the call in front of the front desk staff so they could assist me- they could not get the call to go through either. One man did offer an alternate phone number to try, but that didn't work either. At that point I gave up. Breakfast- I slept through breakfast the first morning and only had time to grab a croissant the second. It was stale. Overall the Principe served its purpose, but I would not recommend it for anyone who has hopes of booking a room with amenities exceeding those of an American Best Western with an extra-nice lobby, or the like. Had the staff been more friendly it would have made all the difference- too bad. However, if you don't care about the frills and you're able to get a decent price, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Happy with it!”
Reviews.Author: Artsy3003
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was not happy with this hotel. Wasn't that easy to find initally, but you won't miss it once you've found it once. The room was nice size and clean with a beautiful small balcony to look at the canal. However the front desk wasn't helpful at all, and the worst part of this hotel is the lack of Air Conditioning. Apparently if you open up ANY window or door slightly in the room, the AC is on sensor to turn off (in which it barely works anyhow.) Not knowing this I go to the front desk to ask about it, and they have all the rooms tapped and know according to which room you are which windows and doors are open. So at this point we learned to keep everything closed, however when the maid comes in every day thereafter and she intentionally keeps the balcony door open just enough so its not noticeable but also just enough to have the AC automatically turn off all day. So after a long hot day of walking around Venice, we come into a room that was very hot and we didn't at first understand why.
