To top it all off, the maid also took my large towel from home that was in my suitcase thinking it was prob there's, I went to the front desk and they said there was nothing they could do for me. The hotel wasn't bad, just for the money we were paying there's no reason to be cheap in summer with the AC, and the front desk could have been more accommodating as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: stereocatz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, right on the grand canal. The Reception and public areas are lovely and everything you would expect from a 4* hotel. As we were staying as part of an organised tour group, check in was taken care of for us . Having previously worked as a hotel receptionist, with experience of tour group arrivals, I thought this was dealt with quickly and effeciently. The room we were allocated was very small with a tiny window overlooking a side alley, and a bit tricky to find due to the layout of the hotel. The Bathroom was also very small, with the shower tray, toilet and basin very close to each other. However as part of a tour, this was to be expected (tour groups are usually allocated the cheapest rooms available). It was cleaned daily and was more than adequate as we didnt spent much time there anyway. There was no trace of a smell as stated in previous reviews and was decorated in a typical venetian style. The breakfast was good, buffet style with waitress service for coffees and teas etc.The service was sometimes quite slow and staff took a long time to replenish items when they ran low, but the quality of the food was good and there was a good variety of items. This hotel offers good value for money, although you are paying for the location rather than great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “An Unpleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Principe earlier this week at the end of an Inntravel walking holiday in the Dolomites. The hotel was chosen on Inntravel's recommendation. This is a truly awful hotel. The first clue comes when you arrive at reception - there are half a dozen folders on the counter from each of the lowest budget UK tour operators - always a bad sign. The staff were completely disinterested and carried on chatting to each other for a minute or two. We were given a key to a very small room which was in need of complete refurbishment. I asked for a better room and after a bit of shrugging and muttering they gave us a key to a room with 'a view of the canal'. It turned out to be on a mezzanine floor betweeen ground and first, had a tiny window, very low ceiling, a strong smell of urine, and air conditioning that barely worked. We resigned ourselves to staying there as we couldn't be bothered to move again, but it was still 28C (82F) in the room after the air conditioning had been running for 2 hours. When I complained the receptionist told me that 'we don't have your ice cold rooms in this country'. A few shrugs later he asked the aging porter to show me a couple of other rooms, all of which were at least 27C (80F). Finally they found us a room which was a mere 24C (75F) which we moved to. The most annoying aspect is that the receptionist seemed to feel he was doing me a great favour by finding me a room with almost working air conditioning, and no smell of urine! Very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location: Fantastic, right in the middle of great shops and restaurants. Situated on the Grand Canal. Next to the Railway Station (200mts max) and walking distance from all famous sites. All hotels on this side are on pedestrian zone and walking distance from the main square. Staff: Very cooperative in stay and helpful with directions and sight seeing tips. Spoke good English. Rooms: Our room was very good and large with attached shower and WC that was very clean and extremely luxurious. Rooms were cleaned everyday. The room had two balconies that would open out to the Grand Canal and the sight was fantastic. We have not had a more exhilarating view and stay so far. Hotel Ambience: Fantastic, immediately you feel you are in a truly class place. Breakfast: More than average. Other Convenience: It is in the middle of action with good restaurants, shops and next to the main water - bus and taxi stand. Overall: Fantastic. Would go back over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to the Grand Canal, taxi boat and train station”
Reviews.Author: sophiehew
Reviews.Content: The room and toilet are small but its Venice, every inch is valuable. The room looks clean, so, it doesn't matter. The hotel serve "ok" food for breakfast and dinner but if you have a choice, just walk around. There are lots of restaurant out there to try. Gelato is everywhere. Usually the one in a cafe or restaurant taste better but for 1 Euro gelato, no complains here. Also check out the China Town Chinese restaurant. I think that's the only one in Venice. The food is pretty good. The hotel is far from the St. Mark Square but its close to the train station. So, take a boat taxi if you don't wanna walk. Walking is fun in Venice since little shops are everywhere. Be sure to pick up a Venezian Mask. The street sign are usually at the corner of each building and occationally you will see signs that show the direction of the bridges. Since Venice is made out of a group of islands, there are bridges everywhere that connect these island. Remember which bridge you are close to is important unless you just wanna get loss :) I recommend to just use ATM card to withdraw some money. Venice is pretty safe but if you are travelling around Italy, just carry only the money you'll need for 2-3 days. ATM/Banco is everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right on canal, steps from train station, try Brec cafe on the right towards train station, great views.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: sweetepea
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Principe, the bedroom was rather small, but adequate very clean, with a fridge and the bathroom was excellent. Super buffet breakfast. Friendly helpful staff. Evening meals disappointing (which we had booked in advance - wish we hadn't) so went out one night to the Brindisi just up the road. Lots of restaurants in the same street of all types. A very central position and easy to get to from the airport by bus and waterbus just one stop. We had a super weekend

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: NJGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, delicious food, friendly service, away from heavy tourist congregations, and accomodating to Americans. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cotswolds_crew
Reviews.Content: Great location, but not a good first impression - the sign is badly in need of replacement. Rooms are quite small and not equipped to an English 4* standard, but they are very clean. Small bathrooms also with showers and tiny baths, but again very clean. Bar lacks atmosphere and drinks are expensive even by English standards. Arrive by water taxi for that touch of luxury. Would stay again as it is so well located, great for the train station and also the bus station for connection to the airports.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: SFBayTraveller
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Hotel Principe. We made our reservation last minute and it was the only hotel on the grand canal that was available. I'm sure there are nicer hotels in Venice but we were very satisfied with the accomadations since we really had no other choice! The room is average size for Europe standards. It was definitely worth it to pay for the canal view. The buffet breakfast was very good as well. The hotel staff weren't overly helpful but they were polite.

Reviews.Title: “lovely lovely lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just booked a short break at the Principe (carefree italy dot com) and enjoyed the break immensely. Not only were their prices so much cheaper than booking direct but the hotel was a complete surprise. Admittedly we had been a little worried after reading a couple of the reviews on this site and others.But we needn't have been. Obviously the muppets that booked this through expedia weren't as well informed as we were! The location looked far from the centre using multimap but was such a short trip by waterbus that it became our retreat from the ever present crowds. We tried to walk it once but 35 minutes on foot was too much for us. The hotel was lovely, the staff were hospitable, breakfast was plentiful, facilities great (no trace of any mouldy smells!) and although the room differered somewhat from those on the hotel website, carefree proved extremely sensible saying any hotel with over 50 rooms won't put all the pictures on their website when they are individually decorated - fair point! Our window overlooked a small central courtyard as we didn't think it was necessary to take a lagoon/canal view. Bumping boats might keep me awake. The immediate area around the hotel was great too with lots of restaurants, bars, small boutique type shops and market stalls. Treated ourselves (pre-booked with Carefree Italy) to a water taxi on our departure and it was worth the expense - being picked up at the private mooring outside the hotel was a luxury you shouldn't miss. Would heartily recommend this or any of the other hotels in the Gardena Chain. the Amadeus is good too and so was the Gardena 3 star hotel. We had a look around and they were sufficiently traditional in aspect to be worth a short break later this year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boogs27
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights in August in Hotel Gardena but as that ended up being full, they moved us to their sister hotel the Principe which was of better quality so we were happy enough with that! The hotel was great. Friendly staff and a fantastic breakfast (cereal, bacon, eggs, bread, croissants, coffee, OJ, ham etc). Location was good. Its 2 minutes from the train station or 10 from the bus station which makes it easy to find. I'd prefer not too stay in a place too close to San Marco square. First because its too touristy and second because it would be a lot harder to find once you arrive on the island! The room we stayed in was room 207 which is right at the front of the hotel on the street. I presume there are better rooms in the hotel as we would have been given essentially the overflow rooms as we came from the Gardena. However, it was big and spacious and there were no problems with it. Even though it was on the street there was no noise whatsoever even with a club across the street. This was due to the incredibly soundproofed windows. A bomb could go off outside and you wouldn't know it! Being in a room on the street was actually great as you could open the full length windows onto a small balcony. The shower was also great and the room was very clean and comfortable. Would stay there again. One thing to note about Venice restaurants. For people that must rely heavily on tourism, they really don't give much of a damn about their customers unless they are Italian. This obviously isn't true of all places but of the 7 or 8 places we ate in, most of them were very unfriendly and service was woeful. All restaurants charge you a cover charge per person, usually about 1.50. This is supposed to cover the bread they bring you. In the majority of cases we were not brought any bread yet were still charged the cover. It just seemed to us that the locals had been brought their bread while the tourists weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: holiguru
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Principe last November and found the hotel really impressive. After staying in quality hotels in Rome, Florence and Amalfi earlier in the year, this hotel scored the highest. The reception was spacious and clean and we loved the ambience of the whole hotel particularly the bar/lounge and restaurant which had views of the canal. The dining experience was great with the evening menu and breakfast choices in abundance. Staff were particularly friendly at this hotel with none of our requests being too much trouble (something which we unfortunately experienced in other hotels in Italy) Our room was lovely - very clean, spacious and comfortable. All in all a great hotel choice for Venice and one to which we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend won a short break in Venice at the Principe Hotel, was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews before going. Fears were not founded however. Lovely room, very tidy, clean, comfortable, staff very helpful, coffee with complimentary croissants, rolls, jam, etc. delivered to room in the morning was nice (only charge was 6 euros for room service, cheap for a great start to the day), drink bar in room was extra but cheap compared to prices in England for a similar hotel. Nice to sit on the canal side by entrance to hotel with a drink after a long day discovering Venice. Would like to go back to this great city sometime and this would be my first hotel of choice even if I have to pay for it this time. Some friends came with us but paid for their stay and their opinion was the same as ours. Couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a tour, so I don't know the room rates. I guess if the price was right, I might stay again, but having stayed at a much nicer hotel around the corner from St. Marks (it was a business trip and I don't know that rate either), I must say I preferred the latter. Its just too far from the main sightseeing areas and the rooms were unexceptional. (As was the food in the dining room). Breakfast was adequate. Maybe I was spoiled by the hotels in Rome and Florence that I stayed in prior. I just think you can probably do better for the same $$.

Reviews.Title: “April in Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay 29th April to 2nd May at this hotel. The room was situated on the very top floor - lift only travelled to the 4th. The room was small but contained all facilities even if a bit old. The bathroom was clean, shower so small you bumped into the walls - however plenty of hot water. Breakfast great overlooking the canal, all the main public room very nice however the staff were miserable and not friendly at all. Good location and easy to find, noisy at night as window needed to be wide open - air conditioning not operational until later in the summer. Would recommend if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved location and getting water taxi to door!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day break at Principe (expedia) and extremely enjoyed the break and hotel. Was a little worried a)after reading a couple of the reviews and b) also that the location may be a little too far from centre but this worry was proved needless on both scores. The hotel was lovely, staff friendly, breakfast good, facilities great (no trace of mouldy smell!) and although the room not similar/as large as advertised on hotel website was perfectly adequate with lovely bathroom. Window overlooked small central courtyard. Easy to walk or catch vaporetto to St. Marks/Rialto but the area around hotel great too with lots of restaurants, bars, shops and interesting bits. Treated ourselves to water taxi from hotel to airport and felt like millionaires - being picked up at mooring outside hotel - (well you're on holiday!!)The best journey I have ever had to an airport ever. Would thoroughly recommend Hotel Principe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day stay at Hotel Principe. We would agree with the last reviewer in that no stench was noticable. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The small room (the norm in Europe) was clean and well furnished with beautiful flooring. It is in an excellent location on the Grand Canal with several affordable restaurants within walking distance. The reason why it is not getting a higher rating is that the room was hot and with the window open it was noisy. We would recommend this hotel if you can get a good deal on the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akb517
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Principe in Venice. I have to say after reading the review about the rooms having a moldy smell, I was a bit hesitant. Thankfully, I was pleasantly surpised by this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in an excellent location and is clean and quite comfortable. The room was small, but very clean. Again, the bathroom was small but modern and plenty of hot water. The buffet breakfast in the morning was wonderul along with the service. Do not expect to find internet service in the hotel. The one computer they have was broken all three days we were there. However, there is an internet cafe right next door to the hotel so it really wasn't a problem. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others and we would stay at the Principe on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room stinked of mold and mildew”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in one of the best rooms (overlooking the Canal); King sized bed. The staff were expecting us, and were friendly and helpful with the exception of the "piano" bar. Upon opening the door to our "450 euro a night during high season" room (of course we payed far less in the winter), a wall of mildew stench slammed into us. I assumed the canal or the air inside the room was at fault, and opened the large balcony windows. No use- the carpeting (unusual for Italian hotels) was completely mildew infested, and stunk like you would not believe. If you moved any of the furniture from it's position on the carpet, a tell-tale carpet discoloration would display the outline of the carpet protected by the furniture versus the exposed nasty carpet. Aside from the constant olfactory assault, the room was quite nice. Spacious, large bathroom, white towel robes, and a great balcony with a tremendous view. Minus the smell, I would have rated this place a FOUR STAR place. Downstairs, the hotel offered a "piano" bar and complementary breakfast the next day in another large room. This "piano" bar is worth skipping, unless you want to suffer the pains of the untalented hack keyboardist working in the lounge butchering classic 70's American rock tunes. Seriously- American Idol blooper clips offer more talent. The service was terribly slow, and the drinks were double the price of what drinks in any of the local establishments outside charged. Also- there is no piano. Perhaps the bar should be renamed "Casio keyboard and positively dreadful Kareoke bar?" Breakfast was a treat, as the hotel caters to American and European tastes- scrambled eggs alongside cold cuts and yogurt, plently of cereals and fruit. A delightful dining experience. Around the hotel are several restaurants within 100 meters, some offering fixed menus (menu turistico) while others did not. The several we ate at were overall excellent, and this hotel's location right near the train station and vaporette (water taxi) stop on the Grand Canal are big pluses. If you plan on visiting Venice, this hotel is fine, minus the smell.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Room Smelled of a Sewer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I do not feel that I can give this hotel more than a "2" rating because of the stench in our room. We booked one of the more expensive rooms (double with a Grand Canal). The room was nice and not too small, but the smell was atrocious! We thought that maybe the Grand Canal was causing the smell, but the air on our balcony was better than the air in our room. We did not complain or request another room because we only stayed for one night. If we were staying for longer, we would have requested another room. The room is too expensive to have the smell it did, or any smell at all!
